      60             : /*!
      61             : @brief namespace for Niels Lohmann
      62             : @see https://github.com/nlohmann
      63             : @since version 1.0.0
      64             : */
      65             : namespace brion_nlohmann
      66             : {
      67             : /*!
      68             : @brief default JSONSerializer template argument
      69             : 
      70             : This serializer ignores the template arguments and uses ADL
      71             : ([argument-dependent lookup](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/adl))
      72             : for serialization.
      73             : */
      74             : template <typename = void, typename = void>
      75             : struct adl_serializer;
      76             : 
      77             : template <template <typename U, typename V, typename... Args> class ObjectType =
      78             :               std::map,
      79             :           template <typename U, typename... Args> class ArrayType = std::vector,
      80             :           class StringType = std::string, class BooleanType = bool,
      81             :           class NumberIntegerType = std::int64_t,
      82             :           class NumberUnsignedType = std::uint64_t,
      83             :           class NumberFloatType = double,
      84             :           template <typename U> class AllocatorType = std::allocator,
      85             :           template <typename T, typename SFINAE = void> class JSONSerializer =
      86             :               adl_serializer>
      87             : class basic_json;
      88             : 
      89             : /*!
      90             : @brief JSON Pointer
      91             : 
      92             : A JSON pointer defines a string syntax for identifying a specific value
      93             : within a JSON document. It can be used with functions `at` and
      94             : `operator[]`. Furthermore, JSON pointers are the base for JSON patches.
      95             : 
      96             : @sa [RFC 6901](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901)
      97             : 
      98             : @since version 2.0.0
      99             : */
     100             : template <typename BasicJsonType>
     101             : class json_pointer;
     102             : 
     103             : /*!
     104             : @brief default JSON class
     105             : 
     106             : This type is the default specialization of the @ref basic_json class which
     107             : uses the standard template types.
     108             : 
     109             : @since version 1.0.0
     110             : */
     111             : using json = basic_json<>;
     112             : }
     113             : 
     114             : #endif
     115             : 
     116             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
     117             : 
     118             : // This file contains all internal macro definitions
     119             : // You MUST include macro_unscope.hpp at the end of json.hpp to undef all of
     120             : // them
     121             : 
     122             : // exclude unsupported compilers
     123             : #if defined(__clang__)
     124             : #if (__clang_major__ * 10000 + __clang_minor__ * 100 + __clang_patchlevel__) < \
     125             :     30400
     126             : #error \
     127             :     "unsupported Clang version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
     128             : #endif
     129             : #elif defined(__GNUC__) && !(defined(__ICC) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER))
     130             : #if (__GNUC__ * 10000 + __GNUC_MINOR__ * 100 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__) < 40800
     131             : #error \
     132             :     "unsupported GCC version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
     133             : #endif
     134             : #endif
     135             : 
     136             : // disable float-equal warnings on GCC/clang
     137             : #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
     138             : #pragma GCC diagnostic push
     139             : #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal"
     140             : #endif
     141             : 
     142             : // disable documentation warnings on clang
     143             : #if defined(__clang__)
     144             : #pragma GCC diagnostic push
     145             : #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wdocumentation"
     146             : #endif
     147             : 
     148             : // allow for portable deprecation warnings
     149             : #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
     150             : #define JSON_DEPRECATED __attribute__((deprecated))
     151             : #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
     152             : #define JSON_DEPRECATED __declspec(deprecated)
     153             : #else
     154             : #define JSON_DEPRECATED
     155             : #endif
     156             : 
     157             : // allow to disable exceptions
     158             : #if (defined(__cpp_exceptions) || defined(__EXCEPTIONS) || \
     159             :      defined(_CPPUNWIND)) &&                               \
     160             :     !defined(JSON_NOEXCEPTION)
     161             : #define JSON_THROW(exception) throw exception
     162             : #define JSON_TRY try
     163             : #define JSON_CATCH(exception) catch (exception)
     164             : #else
     165             : #define JSON_THROW(exception) std::abort()
     166             : #define JSON_TRY if (true)
     167             : #define JSON_CATCH(exception) if (false)
     168             : #endif
     169             : 
     170             : // override exception macros
     171             : #if defined(JSON_THROW_USER)
     172             : #undef JSON_THROW
     173             : #define JSON_THROW JSON_THROW_USER
     174             : #endif
     175             : #if defined(JSON_TRY_USER)
     176             : #undef JSON_TRY
     177             : #define JSON_TRY JSON_TRY_USER
     178             : #endif
     179             : #if defined(JSON_CATCH_USER)
     180             : #undef JSON_CATCH
     181             : #define JSON_CATCH JSON_CATCH_USER
     182             : #endif
     183             : 
     184             : // manual branch prediction
     185             : #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
     186             : #define JSON_LIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 1)
     187             : #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 0)
     188             : #else
     189             : #define JSON_LIKELY(x) x
     190             : #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) x
     191             : #endif
     192             : 
     193             : // C++ language standard detection
     194             : #if (defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201703L) || \
     195             :     (defined(_HAS_CXX17) && _HAS_CXX17 == 1) // fix for issue #464
     196             : #define JSON_HAS_CPP_17
     197             : #define JSON_HAS_CPP_14
     198             : #elif (defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201402L) || \
     199             :     (defined(_HAS_CXX14) && _HAS_CXX14 == 1)
     200             : #define JSON_HAS_CPP_14
     201             : #endif
     202             : 
     203             : // Ugly macros to avoid uglier copy-paste when specializing basic_json. They
     204             : // may be removed in the future once the class is split.
     205             : 
     206             : #define NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION                                 \
     207             :     template <template <typename, typename, typename...> class ObjectType,  \
     208             :               template <typename, typename...> class ArrayType,             \
     209             :               class StringType, class BooleanType, class NumberIntegerType, \
     210             :               class NumberUnsignedType, class NumberFloatType,              \
     211             :               template <typename> class AllocatorType,                      \
     212             :               template <typename, typename = void> class JSONSerializer>
     213             : 
     214             : #define NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL                                        \
     215             :     basic_json<ObjectType, ArrayType, StringType, BooleanType,         \
     216             :                NumberIntegerType, NumberUnsignedType, NumberFloatType, \
     217             :                AllocatorType, JSONSerializer>
     218             : 
     219             : /*!
     220             : @brief Helper to determine whether there's a key_type for T.
     221             : 
     222             : This helper is used to tell associative containers apart from other containers
     223             : such as sequence containers. For instance, `std::map` passes the test as it
     224             : contains a `mapped_type`, whereas `std::vector` fails the test.
     225             : 
     226             : @sa http://stackoverflow.com/a/7728728/266378
     227             : @since version 1.0.0, overworked in version 2.0.6
     228             : */
     229             : #define NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(type)                                    \
     230             :     template <typename T>                                                 \
     231             :     struct has_##type                                                     \
     232             :     {                                                                     \
     233             :     private:                                                              \
     234             :         template <typename U, typename = typename U::type>                \
     235             :         static int detect(U&&);                                           \
     236             :         static void detect(...);                                          \
     237             :                                                                           \
     238             :     public:                                                               \
     239             :         static constexpr bool value =                                     \
     240             :             std::is_integral<decltype(detect(std::declval<T>()))>::value; \
     241             :     }
     242             : 
     243             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta.hpp>
     244             : 
     245             : #include <ciso646>     // not
     246             : #include <cstddef>     // size_t
     247             : #include <limits>      // numeric_limits
     248             : #include <type_traits> // conditional, enable_if, false_type, integral_constant, is_constructible, is_integral, is_same, remove_cv, remove_reference, true_type
     249             : #include <utility>     // declval
     250             : 
     251             : // #include <nlohmann/json_fwd.hpp>
     252             : 
     253             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
     254             : 
     255             : namespace brion_nlohmann
     256             : {
     257             : /*!
     258             : @brief detail namespace with internal helper functions
     259             : 
     260             : This namespace collects functions that should not be exposed,
     261             : implementations of some @ref basic_json methods, and meta-programming helpers.
     262             : 
     263             : @since version 2.1.0
     264             : */
     265             : namespace detail
     266             : {
     267             : /////////////
     268             : // helpers //
     269             : /////////////
     270             : 
     271             : template <typename>
     272             : struct is_basic_json : std::false_type
     273             : {
     274             : };
     275             : 
     276             : NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
     277             : struct is_basic_json<NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL> : std::true_type
     278             : {
     279             : };
     280             : 
     281             : // alias templates to reduce boilerplate
     282             : template <bool B, typename T = void>
     283             : using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
     284             : 
     285             : template <typename T>
     286             : using uncvref_t =
     287             :     typename std::remove_cv<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::type;
     288             : 
     289             : // implementation of C++14 index_sequence and affiliates
     290             : // source: https://stackoverflow.com/a/32223343
     291             : template <std::size_t... Ints>
     292             : struct index_sequence
     293             : {
     294             :     using type = index_sequence;
     295             :     using value_type = std::size_t;
     296             :     static constexpr std::size_t size() noexcept { return sizeof...(Ints); }
     297             : };
     298             : 
     299             : template <class Sequence1, class Sequence2>
     300             : struct merge_and_renumber;
     301             : 
     302             : template <std::size_t... I1, std::size_t... I2>
     303             : struct merge_and_renumber<index_sequence<I1...>, index_sequence<I2...>>
     304             :     : index_sequence<I1..., (sizeof...(I1) + I2)...>
     305             : {
     306             : };
     307             : 
     308             : template <std::size_t N>
     309             : struct make_index_sequence
     310             :     : merge_and_renumber<typename make_index_sequence<N / 2>::type,
     311             :                          typename make_index_sequence<N - N / 2>::type>
     312             : {
     313             : };
     314             : 
     315             : template <>
     316             : struct make_index_sequence<0> : index_sequence<>
     317             : {
     318             : };
     319             : template <>
     320             : struct make_index_sequence<1> : index_sequence<0>
     321             : {
     322             : };
     323             : 
     324             : template <typename... Ts>
     325             : using index_sequence_for = make_index_sequence<sizeof...(Ts)>;
     326             : 
     327             : /*
     328             : Implementation of two C++17 constructs: conjunction, negation. This is needed
     329             : to avoid evaluating all the traits in a condition
     330             : 
     331             : For example: not std::is_same<void, T>::value and has_value_type<T>::value
     332             : will not compile when T = void (on MSVC at least). Whereas
     333             : conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, T>>, has_value_type<T>>::value will
     334             : stop evaluating if negation<...>::value == false
     335             : 
     336             : Please note that those constructs must be used with caution, since symbols can
     337             : become very long quickly (which can slow down compilation and cause MSVC
     338             : internal compiler errors). Only use it when you have to (see example ahead).
     339             : */
     340             : template <class...>
     341             : struct conjunction : std::true_type
     342             : {
     343             : };
     344             : template <class B1>
     345             : struct conjunction<B1> : B1
     346             : {
     347             : };
     348             : template <class B1, class... Bn>
     349             : struct conjunction<B1, Bn...>
     350             :     : std::conditional<bool(B1::value), conjunction<Bn...>, B1>::type
     351             : {
     352             : };
     353             : 
     354             : template <class B>
     355             : struct negation : std::integral_constant<bool, not B::value>
     356             : {
     357             : };
     358             : 
     359             : // dispatch utility (taken from ranges-v3)
     360             : template <unsigned N>
     361             : struct priority_tag : priority_tag<N - 1>
     362             : {
     363             : };
     364             : template <>
     365             : struct priority_tag<0>
     366             : {
     367             : };
     368             : 
     369             : ////////////////////////
     370             : // has_/is_ functions //
     371             : ////////////////////////
     372             : 
     373             : // source: https://stackoverflow.com/a/37193089/4116453
     374             : 
     375             : template <typename T, typename = void>
     376             : struct is_complete_type : std::false_type
     377             : {
     378             : };
     379             : 
     380             : template <typename T>
     381             : struct is_complete_type<T, decltype(void(sizeof(T)))> : std::true_type
     382             : {
     383             : };
     384             : 
     385             : NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(mapped_type);
     386             : NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(key_type);
     387             : NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(value_type);
     388             : NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(iterator);
     389             : 
     390             : template <bool B, class RealType, class CompatibleObjectType>
     391             : struct is_compatible_object_type_impl : std::false_type
     392             : {
     393             : };
     394             : 
     395             : template <class RealType, class CompatibleObjectType>
     396             : struct is_compatible_object_type_impl<true, RealType, CompatibleObjectType>
     397             : {
     398             :     static constexpr auto value =
     399             :         std::is_constructible<
     400             :             typename RealType::key_type,
     401             :             typename CompatibleObjectType::key_type>::value and
     402             :         std::is_constructible<
     403             :             typename RealType::mapped_type,
     404             :             typename CompatibleObjectType::mapped_type>::value;
     405             : };
     406             : 
     407             : template <class BasicJsonType, class CompatibleObjectType>
     408             : struct is_compatible_object_type
     409             : {
     410             :     static auto constexpr value = is_compatible_object_type_impl<
     411             :         conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, CompatibleObjectType>>,
     412             :                     has_mapped_type<CompatibleObjectType>,
     413             :                     has_key_type<CompatibleObjectType>>::value,
     414             :         typename BasicJsonType::object_t, CompatibleObjectType>::value;
     415             : };
     416             : 
     417             : template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
     418             : struct is_basic_json_nested_type
     419             : {
     420             :     static auto constexpr value =
     421             :         std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::iterator>::value or
     422             :         std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::const_iterator>::value or
     423             :         std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::reverse_iterator>::value or
     424             :         std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::const_reverse_iterator>::value;
     425             : };
     426             : 
     427             : template <class BasicJsonType, class CompatibleArrayType>
     428             : struct is_compatible_array_type
     429             : {
     430             :     static auto constexpr value = conjunction<
     431             :         negation<std::is_same<void, CompatibleArrayType>>,
     432             :         negation<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>>,
     433             :         negation<std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t,
     434             :                                        CompatibleArrayType>>,
     435             :         negation<is_basic_json_nested_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>>,
     436             :         has_value_type<CompatibleArrayType>,
     437             :         has_iterator<CompatibleArrayType>>::value;
     438             : };
     439             : 
     440             : template <bool, typename, typename>
     441             : struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl : std::false_type
     442             : {
     443             : };
     444             : 
     445             : template <typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
     446             : struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl<true, RealIntegerType,
     447             :                                        CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
     448             : {
     449             :     // is there an assert somewhere on overflows?
     450             :     using RealLimits = std::numeric_limits<RealIntegerType>;
     451             :     using CompatibleLimits = std::numeric_limits<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>;
     452             : 
     453             :     static constexpr auto value =
     454             :         std::is_constructible<RealIntegerType,
     455             :                               CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
     456             :         CompatibleLimits::is_integer and
     457             :         RealLimits::is_signed == CompatibleLimits::is_signed;
     458             : };
     459             : 
     460             : template <typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
     461             : struct is_compatible_integer_type
     462             : {
     463             :     static constexpr auto
     464             :         value = is_compatible_integer_type_impl <
     465             :                     std::is_integral<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
     466             :                 not std::is_same<bool, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value,
     467             :         RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType > ::value;
     468             : };
     469             : 
     470             : // trait checking if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&, udt&) exists
     471             : template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
     472             : struct has_from_json
     473             : {
     474             : private:
     475             :     // also check the return type of from_json
     476             :     template <typename U, typename = enable_if_t<std::is_same<
     477             :                               void, decltype(uncvref_t<U>::from_json(
     478             :                                         std::declval<BasicJsonType>(),
     479             :                                         std::declval<T&>()))>::value>>
     480             :     static int detect(U&&);
     481             :     static void detect(...);
     482             : 
     483             : public:
     484             :     static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(
     485             :         detect(std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<
     486             :                    T, void>>()))>::value;
     487             : };
     488             : 
     489             : // This trait checks if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&) exists
     490             : // this overload is used for non-default-constructible user-defined-types
     491             : template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
     492             : struct has_non_default_from_json
     493             : {
     494             : private:
     495             :     template <typename U, typename = enable_if_t<std::is_same<
     496             :                               T, decltype(uncvref_t<U>::from_json(
     497             :                                      std::declval<BasicJsonType>()))>::value>>
     498             :     static int detect(U&&);
     499             :     static void detect(...);
     500             : 
     501             : public:
     502             :     static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(
     503             :         detect(std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<
     504             :                    T, void>>()))>::value;
     505             : };
     506             : 
     507             : // This trait checks if BasicJsonType::json_serializer<T>::to_json exists
     508             : template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
     509             : struct has_to_json
     510             : {
     511             : private:
     512             :     template <typename U,
     513             :               typename = decltype(uncvref_t<U>::to_json(
     514             :                   std::declval<BasicJsonType&>(), std::declval<T>()))>
     515             :     static int detect(U&&);
     516             :     static void detect(...);
     517             : 
     518             : public:
     519             :     static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(
     520             :         detect(std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<
     521             :                    T, void>>()))>::value;
     522             : };
     523             : 
     524             : template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleCompleteType>
     525             : struct is_compatible_complete_type
     526             : {
     527             :     static constexpr bool value =
     528             :         not std::is_base_of<std::istream, CompatibleCompleteType>::value and
     529             :         not is_basic_json<CompatibleCompleteType>::value and
     530             :         not is_basic_json_nested_type<BasicJsonType,
     531             :                                       CompatibleCompleteType>::value and
     532             :         has_to_json<BasicJsonType, CompatibleCompleteType>::value;
     533             : };
     534             : 
     535             : template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleType>
     536             : struct is_compatible_type
     537             :     : conjunction<is_complete_type<CompatibleType>,
     538             :                   is_compatible_complete_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleType>>
     539             : {
     540             : };
     541             : 
     542             : // taken from ranges-v3
     543             : template <typename T>
     544             : struct static_const
     545             : {
     546             :     static constexpr T value{};
     547             : };
     548             : 
     549             : template <typename T>
     550             : constexpr T static_const<T>::value;
     551             : }
     552             : }
     553             : 
     554             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
     555             : 
     556             : #include <exception> // exception
     557             : #include <stdexcept> // runtime_error
     558             : #include <string>    // to_string
     559             : 
     560             : namespace brion_nlohmann
     561             : {
     562             : namespace detail
     563             : {
     564             : ////////////////
     565             : // exceptions //
     566             : ////////////////
     567             : 
     568             : /*!
     569             : @brief general exception of the @ref basic_json class
     570             : 
     571             : This class is an extension of `std::exception` objects with a member @a id for
     572             : exception ids. It is used as the base class for all exceptions thrown by the
     573             : @ref basic_json class. This class can hence be used as "wildcard" to catch
     574             : exceptions.
     575             : 
     576             : Subclasses:
     577             : - @ref parse_error for exceptions indicating a parse error
     578             : - @ref invalid_iterator for exceptions indicating errors with iterators
     579             : - @ref type_error for exceptions indicating executing a member function with
     580             :                   a wrong type
     581             : - @ref out_of_range for exceptions indicating access out of the defined range
     582             : - @ref other_error for exceptions indicating other library errors
     583             : 
     584             : @internal
     585             : @note To have nothrow-copy-constructible exceptions, we internally use
     586             :       `std::runtime_error` which can cope with arbitrary-length error messages.
     587             :       Intermediate strings are built with static functions and then passed to
     588             :       the actual constructor.
     589             : @endinternal
     590             : 
     591             : @liveexample{The following code shows how arbitrary library exceptions can be
     592             : caught.,exception}
     593             : 
     594             : @since version 3.0.0
     595             : */
     596           0 : class exception : public std::exception
     597             : {
     598             : public:
     599             :     /// returns the explanatory string
     600           0 :     const char* what() const noexcept override { return m.what(); }
     601             :     /// the id of the exception
     602             :     const int id;
     603             : 
     604             : protected:
     605           0 :     exception(int id_, const char* what_arg)
     606           0 :         : id(id_)
     607           0 :         , m(what_arg)
     608             :     {
     609           0 :     }
     610             : 
     611           0 :     static std::string name(const std::string& ename, int id_)
     612             :     {
     613           0 :         return "[json.exception." + ename + "." + std::to_string(id_) + "] ";
     614             :     }
     615             : 
     616             : private:
     617             :     /// an exception object as storage for error messages
     618             :     std::runtime_error m;
     619             : };
     620             : 
     621             : /*!
     622             : @brief exception indicating a parse error
     623             : 
     624             : This exception is thrown by the library when a parse error occurs. Parse errors
     625             : can occur during the deserialization of JSON text, CBOR, MessagePack, as well
     626             : as when using JSON Patch.
     627             : 
     628             : Member @a byte holds the byte index of the last read character in the input
     629             : file.
     630             : 
     631             : Exceptions have ids 1xx.
     632             : 
     633             : name / id                      | example message | description
     634             : ------------------------------ | --------------- | -------------------------
     635             : json.exception.parse_error.101 | parse error at 2: unexpected end of input;
     636             : expected string literal | This error indicates a syntax error while
     637             : deserializing a JSON text. The error message describes that an unexpected token
     638             : (character) was encountered, and the member @a byte indicates the error
     639             : position.
     640             : json.exception.parse_error.102 | parse error at 14: missing or wrong low
     641             : surrogate | JSON uses the `\uxxxx` format to describe Unicode characters. Code
     642             : points above above 0xFFFF are split into two `\uxxxx` entries ("surrogate
     643             : pairs"). This error indicates that the surrogate pair is incomplete or contains
     644             : an invalid code point.
     645             : json.exception.parse_error.103 | parse error: code points above 0x10FFFF are
     646             : invalid | Unicode supports code points up to 0x10FFFF. Code points above
     647             : 0x10FFFF are invalid.
     648             : json.exception.parse_error.104 | parse error: JSON patch must be an array of
     649             : objects | [RFC 6902](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902) requires a JSON Patch
     650             : document to be a JSON document that represents an array of objects.
     651             : json.exception.parse_error.105 | parse error: operation must have string member
     652             : 'op' | An operation of a JSON Patch document must contain exactly one "op"
     653             : member, whose value indicates the operation to perform. Its value must be one of
     654             : "add", "remove", "replace", "move", "copy", or "test"; other values are errors.
     655             : json.exception.parse_error.106 | parse error: array index '01' must not begin
     656             : with '0' | An array index in a JSON Pointer ([RFC
     657             : 6901](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901)) may be `0` or any number without a
     658             : leading `0`.
     659             : json.exception.parse_error.107 | parse error: JSON pointer must be empty or
     660             : begin with '/' - was: 'foo' | A JSON Pointer must be a Unicode string containing
     661             : a sequence of zero or more reference tokens, each prefixed by a `/` character.
     662             : json.exception.parse_error.108 | parse error: escape character '~' must be
     663             : followed with '0' or '1' | In a JSON Pointer, only `~0` and `~1` are valid
     664             : escape sequences.
     665             : json.exception.parse_error.109 | parse error: array index 'one' is not a number
     666             : | A JSON Pointer array index must be a number.
     667             : json.exception.parse_error.110 | parse error at 1: cannot read 2 bytes from
     668             : vector | When parsing CBOR or MessagePack, the byte vector ends before the
     669             : complete value has been read.
     670             : json.exception.parse_error.112 | parse error at 1: error reading CBOR; last
     671             : byte: 0xF8 | Not all types of CBOR or MessagePack are supported. This exception
     672             : occurs if an unsupported byte was read.
     673             : json.exception.parse_error.113 | parse error at 2: expected a CBOR string; last
     674             : byte: 0x98 | While parsing a map key, a value that is not a string has been
     675             : read.
     676             : 
     677             : @note For an input with n bytes, 1 is the index of the first character and n+1
     678             :       is the index of the terminating null byte or the end of file. This also
     679             :       holds true when reading a byte vector (CBOR or MessagePack).
     680             : 
     681             : @liveexample{The following code shows how a `parse_error` exception can be
     682             : caught.,parse_error}
     683             : 
     684             : @sa @ref exception for the base class of the library exceptions
     685             : @sa @ref invalid_iterator for exceptions indicating errors with iterators
     686             : @sa @ref type_error for exceptions indicating executing a member function with
     687             :                     a wrong type
     688             : @sa @ref out_of_range for exceptions indicating access out of the defined range
     689             : @sa @ref other_error for exceptions indicating other library errors
     690             : 
     691             : @since version 3.0.0
     692             : */
     693           0 : class parse_error : public exception
     694             : {
     695             : public:
     696             :     /*!
     697             :     @brief create a parse error exception
     698             :     @param[in] id_       the id of the exception
     699             :     @param[in] byte_     the byte index where the error occurred (or 0 if the
     700             :                          position cannot be determined)
     701             :     @param[in] what_arg  the explanatory string
     702             :     @return parse_error object
     703             :     */
     704           0 :     static parse_error create(int id_, std::size_t byte_,
     705             :                               const std::string& what_arg)
     706             :     {
     707           0 :         std::string w = exception::name("parse_error", id_) + "parse error" +
     708           0 :                         (byte_ != 0 ? (" at " + std::to_string(byte_)) : "") +
     709           0 :                         ": " + what_arg;
     710           0 :         return parse_error(id_, byte_, w.c_str());
     711             :     }
     712             : 
     713             :     /*!
     714             :     @brief byte index of the parse error
     715             : 
     716             :     The byte index of the last read character in the input file.
     717             : 
     718             :     @note For an input with n bytes, 1 is the index of the first character and
     719             :           n+1 is the index of the terminating null byte or the end of file.
     720             :           This also holds true when reading a byte vector (CBOR or MessagePack).
     721             :     */
     722             :     const std::size_t byte;
     723             : 
     724             : private:
     725           0 :     parse_error(int id_, std::size_t byte_, const char* what_arg)
     726           0 :         : exception(id_, what_arg)
     727           0 :         , byte(byte_)
     728             :     {
     729           0 :     }
     730             : };
     731             : 
     732             : /*!
     733             : @brief exception indicating errors with iterators
     734             : 
     735             : This exception is thrown if iterators passed to a library function do not match
     736             : the expected semantics.
     737             : 
     738             : Exceptions have ids 2xx.
     739             : 
     740             : name / id                           | example message | description
     741             : ----------------------------------- | --------------- |
     742             : -------------------------
     743             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.201 | iterators are not compatible | The
     744             : iterators passed to constructor @ref basic_json(InputIT first, InputIT last) are
     745             : not compatible, meaning they do not belong to the same container. Therefore, the
     746             : range (@a first, @a last) is invalid.
     747             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.202 | iterator does not fit current value | In
     748             : an erase or insert function, the passed iterator @a pos does not belong to the
     749             : JSON value for which the function was called. It hence does not define a valid
     750             : position for the deletion/insertion.
     751             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.203 | iterators do not fit current value |
     752             : Either iterator passed to function @ref erase(IteratorType first, IteratorType
     753             : last) does not belong to the JSON value from which values shall be erased. It
     754             : hence does not define a valid range to delete values from.
     755             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.204 | iterators out of range | When an iterator
     756             : range for a primitive type (number, boolean, or string) is passed to a
     757             : constructor or an erase function, this range has to be exactly (@ref begin(),
     758             : @ref end()), because this is the only way the single stored value is expressed.
     759             : All other ranges are invalid.
     760             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.205 | iterator out of range | When an iterator
     761             : for a primitive type (number, boolean, or string) is passed to an erase
     762             : function, the iterator has to be the @ref begin() iterator, because it is the
     763             : only way to address the stored value. All other iterators are invalid.
     764             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.206 | cannot construct with iterators from null
     765             : | The iterators passed to constructor @ref basic_json(InputIT first, InputIT
     766             : last) belong to a JSON null value and hence to not define a valid range.
     767             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.207 | cannot use key() for non-object iterators
     768             : | The key() member function can only be used on iterators belonging to a JSON
     769             : object, because other types do not have a concept of a key.
     770             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.208 | cannot use operator[] for object iterators
     771             : | The operator[] to specify a concrete offset cannot be used on iterators
     772             : belonging to a JSON object, because JSON objects are unordered.
     773             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.209 | cannot use offsets with object iterators |
     774             : The offset operators (+, -, +=, -=) cannot be used on iterators belonging to a
     775             : JSON object, because JSON objects are unordered.
     776             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.210 | iterators do not fit | The iterator range
     777             : passed to the insert function are not compatible, meaning they do not belong to
     778             : the same container. Therefore, the range (@a first, @a last) is invalid.
     779             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.211 | passed iterators may not belong to
     780             : container | The iterator range passed to the insert function must not be a
     781             : subrange of the container to insert to.
     782             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.212 | cannot compare iterators of different
     783             : containers | When two iterators are compared, they must belong to the same
     784             : container.
     785             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.213 | cannot compare order of object iterators |
     786             : The order of object iterators cannot be compared, because JSON objects are
     787             : unordered.
     788             : json.exception.invalid_iterator.214 | cannot get value | Cannot get value for
     789             : iterator: Either the iterator belongs to a null value or it is an iterator to a
     790             : primitive type (number, boolean, or string), but the iterator is different to
     791             : @ref begin().
     792             : 
     793             : @liveexample{The following code shows how an `invalid_iterator` exception can be
     794             : caught.,invalid_iterator}
     795             : 
     796             : @sa @ref exception for the base class of the library exceptions
     797             : @sa @ref parse_error for exceptions indicating a parse error
     798             : @sa @ref type_error for exceptions indicating executing a member function with
     799             :                     a wrong type
     800             : @sa @ref out_of_range for exceptions indicating access out of the defined range
     801             : @sa @ref other_error for exceptions indicating other library errors
     802             : 
     803             : @since version 3.0.0
     804             : */
     805           0 : class invalid_iterator : public exception
     806             : {
     807             : public:
     808           0 :     static invalid_iterator create(int id_, const std::string& what_arg)
     809             :     {
     810           0 :         std::string w = exception::name("invalid_iterator", id_) + what_arg;
     811           0 :         return invalid_iterator(id_, w.c_str());
     812             :     }
     813             : 
     814             : private:
     815           0 :     invalid_iterator(int id_, const char* what_arg)
     816           0 :         : exception(id_, what_arg)
     817             :     {
     818           0 :     }
     819             : };
     820             : 
     821             : /*!
     822             : @brief exception indicating executing a member function with a wrong type
     823             : 
     824             : This exception is thrown in case of a type error; that is, a library function is
     825             : executed on a JSON value whose type does not match the expected semantics.
     826             : 
     827             : Exceptions have ids 3xx.
     828             : 
     829             : name / id                     | example message | description
     830             : ----------------------------- | --------------- | -------------------------
     831             : json.exception.type_error.301 | cannot create object from initializer list | To
     832             : create an object from an initializer list, the initializer list must consist
     833             : only of a list of pairs whose first element is a string. When this constraint is
     834             : violated, an array is created instead.
     835             : json.exception.type_error.302 | type must be object, but is array | During
     836             : implicit or explicit value conversion, the JSON type must be compatible to the
     837             : target type. For instance, a JSON string can only be converted into string
     838             : types, but not into numbers or boolean types.
     839             : json.exception.type_error.303 | incompatible ReferenceType for get_ref, actual
     840             : type is object | To retrieve a reference to a value stored in a @ref basic_json
     841             : object with @ref get_ref, the type of the reference must match the value type.
     842             : For instance, for a JSON array, the @a ReferenceType must be @ref array_t&.
     843             : json.exception.type_error.304 | cannot use at() with string | The @ref at()
     844             : member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
     845             : json.exception.type_error.305 | cannot use operator[] with string | The @ref
     846             : operator[] member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
     847             : json.exception.type_error.306 | cannot use value() with string | The @ref
     848             : value() member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
     849             : json.exception.type_error.307 | cannot use erase() with string | The @ref
     850             : erase() member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
     851             : json.exception.type_error.308 | cannot use push_back() with string | The @ref
     852             : push_back() and @ref operator+= member functions can only be executed for
     853             : certain JSON types.
     854             : json.exception.type_error.309 | cannot use insert() with | The @ref insert()
     855             : member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
     856             : json.exception.type_error.310 | cannot use swap() with number | The @ref swap()
     857             : member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
     858             : json.exception.type_error.311 | cannot use emplace_back() with string | The @ref
     859             : emplace_back() member function can only be executed for certain JSON types.
     860             : json.exception.type_error.312 | cannot use update() with string | The @ref
     861             : update() member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
     862             : json.exception.type_error.313 | invalid value to unflatten | The @ref unflatten
     863             : function converts an object whose keys are JSON Pointers back into an arbitrary
     864             : nested JSON value. The JSON Pointers must not overlap, because then the
     865             : resulting value would not be well defined.
     866             : json.exception.type_error.314 | only objects can be unflattened | The @ref
     867             : unflatten function only works for an object whose keys are JSON Pointers.
     868             : json.exception.type_error.315 | values in object must be primitive | The @ref
     869             : unflatten function only works for an object whose keys are JSON Pointers and
     870             : whose values are primitive.
     871             : json.exception.type_error.316 | invalid UTF-8 byte at index 10: 0x7E | The @ref
     872             : dump function only works with UTF-8 encoded strings; that is, if you assign a
     873             : `std::string` to a JSON value, make sure it is UTF-8 encoded. |
     874             : 
     875             : @liveexample{The following code shows how a `type_error` exception can be
     876             : caught.,type_error}
     877             : 
     878             : @sa @ref exception for the base class of the library exceptions
     879             : @sa @ref parse_error for exceptions indicating a parse error
     880             : @sa @ref invalid_iterator for exceptions indicating errors with iterators
     881             : @sa @ref out_of_range for exceptions indicating access out of the defined range
     882             : @sa @ref other_error for exceptions indicating other library errors
     883             : 
     884             : @since version 3.0.0
     885             : */
     886           0 : class type_error : public exception
     887             : {
     888             : public:
     889           0 :     static type_error create(int id_, const std::string& what_arg)
     890             :     {
     891           0 :         std::string w = exception::name("type_error", id_) + what_arg;
     892           0 :         return type_error(id_, w.c_str());
     893             :     }
     894             : 
     895             : private:
     896           0 :     type_error(int id_, const char* what_arg)
     897           0 :         : exception(id_, what_arg)
     898             :     {
     899           0 :     }
     900             : };
     901             : 
     902             : /*!
     903             : @brief exception indicating access out of the defined range
     904             : 
     905             : This exception is thrown in case a library function is called on an input
     906             : parameter that exceeds the expected range, for instance in case of array
     907             : indices or nonexisting object keys.
     908             : 
     909             : Exceptions have ids 4xx.
     910             : 
     911             : name / id                       | example message | description
     912             : ------------------------------- | --------------- | -------------------------
     913             : json.exception.out_of_range.401 | array index 3 is out of range | The provided
     914             : array index @a i is larger than @a size-1.
     915             : json.exception.out_of_range.402 | array index '-' (3) is out of range | The
     916             : special array index `-` in a JSON Pointer never describes a valid element of the
     917             : array, but the index past the end. That is, it can only be used to add elements
     918             : at this position, but not to read it.
     919             : json.exception.out_of_range.403 | key 'foo' not found | The provided key was not
     920             : found in the JSON object.
     921             : json.exception.out_of_range.404 | unresolved reference token 'foo' | A reference
     922             : token in a JSON Pointer could not be resolved.
     923             : json.exception.out_of_range.405 | JSON pointer has no parent | The JSON Patch
     924             : operations 'remove' and 'add' can not be applied to the root element of the JSON
     925             : value.
     926             : json.exception.out_of_range.406 | number overflow parsing '10E1000' | A parsed
     927             : number could not be stored as without changing it to NaN or INF.
     928             : json.exception.out_of_range.407 | number overflow serializing
     929             : '9223372036854775808' | UBJSON only supports integers numbers up to
     930             : 9223372036854775807. |
     931             : json.exception.out_of_range.408 | excessive array size: 8658170730974374167 |
     932             : The size (following `#`) of an UBJSON array or object exceeds the maximal
     933             : capacity. |
     934             : 
     935             : @liveexample{The following code shows how an `out_of_range` exception can be
     936             : caught.,out_of_range}
     937             : 
     938             : @sa @ref exception for the base class of the library exceptions
     939             : @sa @ref parse_error for exceptions indicating a parse error
     940             : @sa @ref invalid_iterator for exceptions indicating errors with iterators
     941             : @sa @ref type_error for exceptions indicating executing a member function with
     942             :                     a wrong type
     943             : @sa @ref other_error for exceptions indicating other library errors
     944             : 
     945             : @since version 3.0.0
     946             : */
     947           0 : class out_of_range : public exception
     948             : {
     949             : public:
     950           0 :     static out_of_range create(int id_, const std::string& what_arg)
     951             :     {
     952           0 :         std::string w = exception::name("out_of_range", id_) + what_arg;
     953           0 :         return out_of_range(id_, w.c_str());
     954             :     }
     955             : 
     956             : private:
     957           0 :     out_of_range(int id_, const char* what_arg)
     958           0 :         : exception(id_, what_arg)
     959             :     {
     960           0 :     }
     961             : };
     962             : 
     963             : /*!
     964             : @brief exception indicating other library errors
     965             : 
     966             : This exception is thrown in case of errors that cannot be classified with the
     967             : other exception types.
     968             : 
     969             : Exceptions have ids 5xx.
     970             : 
     971             : name / id                      | example message | description
     972             : ------------------------------ | --------------- | -------------------------
     973             : json.exception.other_error.501 | unsuccessful: {"op":"test","path":"/baz",
     974             : "value":"bar"} | A JSON Patch operation 'test' failed. The unsuccessful
     975             : operation is also printed.
     976             : 
     977             : @sa @ref exception for the base class of the library exceptions
     978             : @sa @ref parse_error for exceptions indicating a parse error
     979             : @sa @ref invalid_iterator for exceptions indicating errors with iterators
     980             : @sa @ref type_error for exceptions indicating executing a member function with
     981             :                     a wrong type
     982             : @sa @ref out_of_range for exceptions indicating access out of the defined range
     983             : 
     984             : @liveexample{The following code shows how an `other_error` exception can be
     985             : caught.,other_error}
     986             : 
     987             : @since version 3.0.0
     988             : */
     989           0 : class other_error : public exception
     990             : {
     991             : public:
     992           0 :     static other_error create(int id_, const std::string& what_arg)
     993             :     {
     994           0 :         std::string w = exception::name("other_error", id_) + what_arg;
     995           0 :         return other_error(id_, w.c_str());
     996             :     }
     997             : 
     998             : private:
     999           0 :     other_error(int id_, const char* what_arg)
    1000           0 :         : exception(id_, what_arg)
    1001             :     {
    1002           0 :     }
    1003             : };
    1004             : }
    1005             : }
    1006             : 
    1007             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
    1008             : 
    1009             : #include <array>   // array
    1010             : #include <ciso646> // and
    1011             : #include <cstddef> // size_t
    1012             : #include <cstdint> // uint8_t
    1013             : 
    1014             : namespace brion_nlohmann
    1015             : {
    1016             : namespace detail
    1017             : {
    1018             : ///////////////////////////
    1019             : // JSON type enumeration //
    1020             : ///////////////////////////
    1021             : 
    1022             : /*!
    1023             : @brief the JSON type enumeration
    1024             : 
    1025             : This enumeration collects the different JSON types. It is internally used to
    1026             : distinguish the stored values, and the functions @ref basic_json::is_null(),
    1027             : @ref basic_json::is_object(), @ref basic_json::is_array(),
    1028             : @ref basic_json::is_string(), @ref basic_json::is_boolean(),
    1029             : @ref basic_json::is_number() (with @ref basic_json::is_number_integer(),
    1030             : @ref basic_json::is_number_unsigned(), and @ref basic_json::is_number_float()),
    1031             : @ref basic_json::is_discarded(), @ref basic_json::is_primitive(), and
    1032             : @ref basic_json::is_structured() rely on it.
    1033             : 
    1034             : @note There are three enumeration entries (number_integer, number_unsigned, and
    1035             : number_float), because the library distinguishes these three types for numbers:
    1036             : @ref basic_json::number_unsigned_t is used for unsigned integers,
    1037             : @ref basic_json::number_integer_t is used for signed integers, and
    1038             : @ref basic_json::number_float_t is used for floating-point numbers or to
    1039             : approximate integers which do not fit in the limits of their respective type.
    1040             : 
    1041             : @sa @ref basic_json::basic_json(const value_t value_type) -- create a JSON
    1042             : value with the default value for a given type
    1043             : 
    1044             : @since version 1.0.0
    1045             : */
    1046             : enum class value_t : std::uint8_t
    1047             : {
    1048             :     null,            ///< null value
    1049             :     object,          ///< object (unordered set of name/value pairs)
    1050             :     array,           ///< array (ordered collection of values)
    1051             :     string,          ///< string value
    1052             :     boolean,         ///< boolean value
    1053             :     number_integer,  ///< number value (signed integer)
    1054             :     number_unsigned, ///< number value (unsigned integer)
    1055             :     number_float,    ///< number value (floating-point)
    1056             :     discarded        ///< discarded by the the parser callback function
    1057             : };
    1058             : 
    1059             : /*!
    1060             : @brief comparison operator for JSON types
    1061             : 
    1062             : Returns an ordering that is similar to Python:
    1063             : - order: null < boolean < number < object < array < string
    1064             : - furthermore, each type is not smaller than itself
    1065             : - discarded values are not comparable
    1066             : 
    1067             : @since version 1.0.0
    1068             : */
    1069             : inline bool operator<(const value_t lhs, const value_t rhs) noexcept
    1070             : {
    1071             :     static constexpr std::array<std::uint8_t, 8> order = {{
    1072             :         0 /* null */, 3 /* object */, 4 /* array */, 5 /* string */,
    1073             :         1 /* boolean */, 2 /* integer */, 2 /* unsigned */, 2 /* float */
    1074             :     }};
    1075             : 
    1076             :     const auto l_index = static_cast<std::size_t>(lhs);
    1077             :     const auto r_index = static_cast<std::size_t>(rhs);
    1078             :     return l_index < order.size() and r_index < order.size() and
    1079             :            order[l_index] < order[r_index];
    1080             : }
    1081             : }
    1082             : }
    1083             : 
    1084             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/conversions/from_json.hpp>
    1085             : 
    1086             : #include <algorithm>    // transform
    1087             : #include <array>        // array
    1088             : #include <ciso646>      // and, not
    1089             : #include <forward_list> // forward_list
    1090             : #include <iterator>     // inserter, front_inserter, end
    1091             : #include <string>       // string
    1092             : #include <tuple>        // tuple, make_tuple
    1093             : #include <type_traits> // is_arithmetic, is_same, is_enum, underlying_type, is_convertible
    1094             : #include <utility>  // pair, declval
    1095             : #include <valarray> // valarray
    1096             : 
    1097             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
    1098             : 
    1099             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
    1100             : 
    1101             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta.hpp>
    1102             : 
    1103             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
    1104             : 
    1105             : namespace brion_nlohmann
    1106             : {
    1107             : namespace detail
    1108             : {
    1109             : // overloads for basic_json template parameters
    1110             : template <
    1111             :     typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
    1112             :     enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
    1113             :                     not std::is_same<ArithmeticType,
    1114             :                                      typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
    1115             :                 int> = 0>
    1116             : void get_arithmetic_value(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val)
    1117             : {
    1118             :     switch (static_cast<value_t>(j))
    1119             :     {
    1120             :     case value_t::number_unsigned:
    1121             :     {
    1122             :         val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(
    1123             :             *j.template get_ptr<
    1124             :                 const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
    1125             :         break;
    1126             :     }
    1127             :     case value_t::number_integer:
    1128             :     {
    1129             :         val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(
    1130             :             *j.template get_ptr<
    1131             :                 const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
    1132             :         break;
    1133             :     }
    1134             :     case value_t::number_float:
    1135             :     {
    1136             :         val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(
    1137             :             *j.template get_ptr<
    1138             :                 const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
    1139             :         break;
    1140             :     }
    1141             : 
    1142             :     default:
    1143             :         JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " +
    1144             :                                                std::string(j.type_name())));
    1145             :     }
    1146             : }
    1147             : 
    1148             : template <typename BasicJsonType>
    1149             : void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t& b)
    1150             : {
    1151             :     if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_boolean()))
    1152             :     {
    1153             :         JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " +
    1154             :                                                std::string(j.type_name())));
    1155             :     }
    1156             :     b = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>();
    1157             : }
    1158             : 
    1159             : template <typename BasicJsonType>
    1160         242 : void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s)
    1161             : {
    1162         242 :     if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_string()))
    1163             :     {
    1164           0 :         JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be string, but is " +
    1165             :                                                std::string(j.type_name())));
    1166             :     }

    1194             : {

    1196             :     get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
    1197             :     e = static_cast<EnumType>(val);
    1198             : }
    1199             : 
    1200             : template <typename BasicJsonType>
    1201             : void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr)
    1202             : {
    1203             :     if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
    1204             :     {

    1207             :     }
    1208             :     arr = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::array_t*>();
    1209             : }
    1210             : 
    1211             : // forward_list doesn't have an insert method
    1212             : template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename Allocator,
    1213             :           enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, T>::value, int> = 0>
    1214             : void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::forward_list<T, Allocator>& l)
    1215             : {
    1216             :     if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
    1217             :     {

    1219             :                                                std::string(j.type_name())));
    1220             :     }

    1222             :                    [](const BasicJsonType& i) { return i.template get<T>(); });
    1223             : }
    1224             : 
    1225             : // valarray doesn't have an insert method
    1226             : template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T,

    1229             : {
    1230             :     if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
    1231             :     {

    1233             :                                                std::string(j.type_name())));
    1234             :     }
    1235             :     l.resize(j.size());
    1236             :     std::copy(j.m_value.array->begin(), j.m_value.array->end(), std::begin(l));
    1237             : }
    1238             : 
    1239             : template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
    1240             : void from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr,
    1241             :                           priority_tag<0> /*unused*/)
    1242             : {
    1243             :     using std::end;
    1244             : 
    1245             :     std::transform(
    1246             :         j.begin(), j.end(), std::inserter(arr, end(arr)),

    1249             :             // method when value_type is BasicJsonType

    1251             :         });
    1252             : }
    1253             : 
    1254             : template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>

    1258             :         arr.reserve(std::declval<typename CompatibleArrayType::size_type>()),
    1259             :         void())
    1260             : {
    1261             :     using std::end;
    1262             :

    1273             : template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, std::size_t N>

    1275             :                           priority_tag<2> /*unused*/)
    1276             : {
    1277             :     for (std::size_t i = 0; i < N; ++i)
    1278             :     {
    1279             :         arr[i] = j.at(i).template get<T>();
    1280             :     }
    1281             : }
    1282             :

    1304             :           enable_if_t<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType,

    1327             : 
    1328             : // overload for arithmetic types, not chosen for basic_json template arguments
    1329             : // (BooleanType, etc..); note: Is it really necessary to provide explicit
    1330             : // overloads for boolean_t etc. in case of a custom BooleanType which is not
    1331             : // an arithmetic type?

    1385             : {
    1386             :     p = {j.at(0).template get<A1>(), j.at(1).template get<A2>()};

    1403             : 
    1404             : struct from_json_fn
    1405             : {
    1406             : private:
    1407             :     template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
    1408         242 :     auto call(const BasicJsonType& j, T& val, priority_tag<1> /*unused*/) const
    1409             :         noexcept(noexcept(from_json(j, val)))
    1410             :             -> decltype(from_json(j, val), void())
    1411             :     {
    1412         242 :         return from_json(j, val);
    1413             :     }
    1414             : 
    1415             :     template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
    1416             :     void call(const BasicJsonType& /*unused*/, T& /*unused*/,
    1417             :               priority_tag<0> /*unused*/) const noexcept
    1418             :     {
    1419             :         static_assert(sizeof(BasicJsonType) == 0,
    1420             :                       "could not find from_json() method in T's namespace");
    1421             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
    1422             :         // MSVC does not show a stacktrace for the above assert
    1423             :         using decayed = uncvref_t<T>;
    1424             :         static_assert(
    1425             :             sizeof(typename decayed::force_msvc_stacktrace) == 0,
    1426             :             "forcing MSVC stacktrace to show which T we're talking about.");
    1427             : #endif
    1428             :     }
    1429             : 
    1430             : public:

    1434             :                                                             priority_tag<1>{})))
    1435             :     {
    1436         242 :         return call(j, val, priority_tag<1>{});
    1437             :     }
    1438             : };
    1439             : }
    1440             : 
    1441             : /// namespace to hold default `from_json` function
    1442             : /// to see why this is required:
    1443             : /// http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2015/n4381.html
    1444             : namespace
    1445             : {
    1446             : constexpr const auto& from_json =
    1447             :     detail::static_const<detail::from_json_fn>::value;
    1448             : }
    1449             : }
    1450             : 
    1451             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/conversions/to_json.hpp>
    1452             : 
    1453             : #include <ciso646>  // or, and, not
    1454             : #include <iterator> // begin, end
    1455             : #include <tuple>    // tuple, get

    1466             : {
    1467             : namespace detail
    1468             : {
    1469             : //////////////////
    1470             : // constructors //
    1471             : //////////////////
    1472             : 
    1473             : template <value_t>
    1474             : struct external_constructor;
    1475             : 
    1476             : template <>
    1477             : struct external_constructor<value_t::boolean>
    1478             : {
    1479             :     template <typename BasicJsonType>
    1480             :     static void construct(BasicJsonType& j,
    1481             :                           typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t b) noexcept
    1482             :     {
    1483             :         j.m_type = value_t::boolean;
    1484             :         j.m_value = b;
    1485             :         j.assert_invariant();
    1486             :     }
    1487             : };
    1488             : 
    1489             : template <>
    1490             : struct external_constructor<value_t::string>
    1491             : {
    1492             :     template <typename BasicJsonType>
    1493          77 :     static void construct(BasicJsonType& j,
    1494             :                           const typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s)
    1495             :     {
    1496          77 :         j.m_type = value_t::string;
    1497          77 :         j.m_value = s;
    1498          77 :         j.assert_invariant();
    1499          77 :     }
    1500             : 
    1501             :     template <typename BasicJsonType>
    1502             :     static void construct(BasicJsonType& j,
    1503             :                           typename BasicJsonType::string_t&& s)
    1504             :     {
    1505             :         j.m_type = value_t::string;
    1506             :         j.m_value = std::move(s);
    1507             :         j.assert_invariant();
    1508             :     }
    1509             : };
    1510             : 
    1511             : template <>
    1512             : struct external_constructor<value_t::number_float>
    1513             : {
    1514             :     template <typename BasicJsonType>
    1515             :     static void construct(BasicJsonType& j,
    1516             :                           typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t val) noexcept
    1517             :     {
    1518             :         j.m_type = value_t::number_float;
    1519             :         j.m_value = val;
    1520             :         j.assert_invariant();
    1521             :     }
    1522             : };
    1523             : 
    1524             : template <>
    1525             : struct external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned>

    1528             :     static void construct(

    1537             :

    1544             :     {
