    1549             : };
    1550             : 
    1551             : template <>
    1552             : struct external_constructor<value_t::array>
    1553             : {
    1554             :     template <typename BasicJsonType>
    1555             :     static void construct(BasicJsonType& j,
    1556             :                           const typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr)
    1557             :     {
    1558             :         j.m_type = value_t::array;
    1559             :         j.m_value = arr;
    1560             :         j.assert_invariant();
    1561             :     }
    1562             : 
    1563             :     template <typename BasicJsonType>
    1564             :     static void construct(BasicJsonType& j,
    1565             :                           typename BasicJsonType::array_t&& arr)
    1566             :     {
    1567             :         j.m_type = value_t::array;
    1568             :         j.m_value = std::move(arr);
    1569             :         j.assert_invariant();
    1570             :     }
    1571             : 
    1572             :     template <
    1573             :         typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
    1574             :         enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleArrayType,
    1575             :                                      typename BasicJsonType::array_t>::value,
    1576             :                     int> = 0>
    1577             :     static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr)
    1578             :     {
    1579             :         using std::begin;
    1580             :         using std::end;
    1581             :         j.m_type = value_t::array;
    1582             :         j.m_value.array =
    1583             :             j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::array_t>(begin(arr),
    1584             :                                                                end(arr));
    1585             :         j.assert_invariant();
    1586             :     }
    1587             : 
    1588             :     template <typename BasicJsonType>
    1589             :     static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& arr)
    1590             :     {
    1591             :         j.m_type = value_t::array;
    1592             :         j.m_value = value_t::array;
    1593             :         j.m_value.array->reserve(arr.size());
    1594             :         for (const bool x : arr)
    1595             :         {
    1596             :             j.m_value.array->push_back(x);
    1597             :         }
    1598             :         j.assert_invariant();
    1599             :     }
    1600             : 
    1601             :     template <
    1602             :         typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
    1603             :         enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<T, BasicJsonType>::value, int> = 0>
    1604             :     static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const std::valarray<T>& arr)
    1605             :     {
    1606             :         j.m_type = value_t::array;
    1607             :         j.m_value = value_t::array;
    1608             :         j.m_value.array->resize(arr.size());
    1609             :         std::copy(std::begin(arr), std::end(arr), j.m_value.array->begin());
    1610             :         j.assert_invariant();
    1611             :     }
    1612             : };
    1613             : 
    1614             : template <>
    1615             : struct external_constructor<value_t::object>
    1616             : {
    1617             :     template <typename BasicJsonType>
    1618             :     static void construct(BasicJsonType& j,
    1619             :                           const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& obj)

    1621             :         j.m_type = value_t::object;

    1623             :         j.assert_invariant();
    1624             :     }
    1625             :

    1629             :     {
    1630             :         j.m_type = value_t::object;

    1775             : {
    1776             :     j = {p.first, p.second};
    1777             : }

    1780             : void to_json_tuple_impl(BasicJsonType& j, const Tuple& t,
    1781             :                         index_sequence<Idx...>)
    1782             : {
    1783             :     j = {std::get<Idx>(t)...};
    1784             : }
    1785             : 
    1786             : template <typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
    1787             : void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::tuple<Args...>& t)
    1788             : {
    1789             :     to_json_tuple_impl(j, t, index_sequence_for<Args...>{});
    1790             : }
    1791             : 
    1792             : struct to_json_fn
    1793             : {
    1794             : private:
    1795             :     template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
    1796          77 :     auto call(BasicJsonType& j, T&& val, priority_tag<1> /*unused*/) const
    1797             :         noexcept(noexcept(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val))))
    1798             :             -> decltype(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val)), void())
    1799             :     {
    1800          77 :         return to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val));
    1801             :     }
    1802             : 
    1803             :     template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
    1804             :     void call(BasicJsonType& /*unused*/, T&& /*unused*/,
    1805             :               priority_tag<0> /*unused*/) const noexcept
    1806             :     {
    1807             :         static_assert(sizeof(BasicJsonType) == 0,
    1808             :                       "could not find to_json() method in T's namespace");
    1809             : 
    1810             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
    1811             :         // MSVC does not show a stacktrace for the above assert
    1812             :         using decayed = uncvref_t<T>;
    1813             :         static_assert(
    1814             :             sizeof(typename decayed::force_msvc_stacktrace) == 0,
    1815             :             "forcing MSVC stacktrace to show which T we're talking about.");
    1816             : #endif
    1817             :     }
    1818             : 
    1819             : public:
    1820             :     template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
    1821          77 :     void operator()(BasicJsonType& j, T&& val) const
    1822             :         noexcept(noexcept(std::declval<to_json_fn>().call(j,
    1823             :                                                           std::forward<T>(val),
    1824             :                                                           priority_tag<1>{})))
    1825             :     {
    1826          77 :         return call(j, std::forward<T>(val), priority_tag<1>{});
    1827             :     }
    1828             : };
    1829             : }
    1830             : 
    1831             : /// namespace to hold default `to_json` function
    1832             : namespace
    1833             : {
    1834             : constexpr const auto& to_json = detail::static_const<detail::to_json_fn>::value;
    1835             : }
    1836             : }
    1837             : 
    1838             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/input_adapters.hpp>
    1839             : 
    1840             : #include <algorithm> // min
    1841             : #include <array>     // array
    1842             : #include <cassert>   // assert
    1843             : #include <cstddef>   // size_t
    1844             : #include <cstring>   // strlen
    1845             : #include <ios>       // streamsize, streamoff, streampos
    1846             : #include <istream>   // istream
    1847             : #include <iterator> // begin, end, iterator_traits, random_access_iterator_tag, distance, next
    1848             : #include <memory>  // shared_ptr, make_shared, addressof
    1849             : #include <numeric> // accumulate
    1850             : #include <string>  // string, char_traits
    1851             : #include <type_traits> // enable_if, is_base_of, is_pointer, is_integral, remove_pointer
    1852             : #include <utility> // pair, declval
    1853             : 
    1854             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
    1855             : 
    1856             : namespace brion_nlohmann
    1857             : {
    1858             : namespace detail
    1859             : {
    1860             : ////////////////////
    1861             : // input adapters //
    1862             : ////////////////////
    1863             : 
    1864             : /*!
    1865             : @brief abstract input adapter interface
    1866             : 
    1867             : Produces a stream of std::char_traits<char>::int_type characters from a
    1868             : std::istream, a buffer, or some other input type.  Accepts the return of exactly
    1869             : one non-EOF character for future input.  The int_type characters returned
    1870             : consist of all valid char values as positive values (typically unsigned char),
    1871             : plus an EOF value outside that range, specified by the value of the function
    1872             : std::char_traits<char>::eof().  This value is typically -1, but could be any
    1873             : arbitrary value which is not a valid char value.
    1874             : */
    1875          11 : struct input_adapter_protocol
    1876             : {
    1877             :     /// get a character [0,255] or std::char_traits<char>::eof().
    1878             :     virtual std::char_traits<char>::int_type get_character() = 0;
    1879             :     /// restore the last non-eof() character to input
    1880             :     virtual void unget_character() = 0;
    1881          11 :     virtual ~input_adapter_protocol() = default;
    1882             : };
    1883             : 
    1884             : /// a type to simplify interfaces
    1885             : using input_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<input_adapter_protocol>;
    1886             : 
    1887             : /*!
    1888             : Input adapter for a (caching) istream. Ignores a UFT Byte Order Mark at
    1889             : beginning of input. Does not support changing the underlying std::streambuf
    1890             : in mid-input. Maintains underlying std::istream and std::streambuf to support
    1891             : subsequent use of standard std::istream operations to process any input
    1892             : characters following those used in parsing the JSON input.  Clears the
    1893             : std::istream flags; any input errors (e.g., EOF) will be detected by the first
    1894             : subsequent call for input from the std::istream.
    1895             : */
    1896             : class input_stream_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
    1897             : {
    1898             : public:
    1899          11 :     ~input_stream_adapter() override
    1900          22 :     {
    1901             :         // clear stream flags; we use underlying streambuf I/O, do not
    1902             :         // maintain ifstream flags
    1903          11 :         is.clear();
    1904          11 :     }
    1905             : 
    1906          11 :     explicit input_stream_adapter(std::istream& i)
    1907          11 :         : is(i)
    1908          11 :         , sb(*i.rdbuf())
    1909             :     {
    1910             :         // skip byte order mark
    1911             :         std::char_traits<char>::int_type c;
    1912          11 :         if ((c = get_character()) == 0xEF)
    1913             :         {
    1914           0 :             if ((c = get_character()) == 0xBB)
    1915             :             {
    1916           0 :                 if ((c = get_character()) == 0xBF)
    1917             :                 {
    1918           0 :                     return; // Ignore BOM
    1919             :                 }
    1920           0 :                 else if (c != std::char_traits<char>::eof())
    1921             :                 {
    1922           0 :                     is.unget();
    1923             :                 }
    1924           0 :                 is.putback('\xBB');
    1925             :             }
    1926           0 :             else if (c != std::char_traits<char>::eof())
    1927             :             {
    1928           0 :                 is.unget();
    1929             :             }
    1930           0 :             is.putback('\xEF');
    1931             :         }
    1932          11 :         else if (c != std::char_traits<char>::eof())
    1933             :         {
    1934          11 :             is.unget(); // no byte order mark; process as usual
    1935             :         }
    1936             :     }
    1937             : 
    1938             :     // delete because of pointer members
    1939             :     input_stream_adapter(const input_stream_adapter&) = delete;
    1940             :     input_stream_adapter& operator=(input_stream_adapter&) = delete;
    1941             : 
    1942             :     // std::istream/std::streambuf use std::char_traits<char>::to_int_type, to
    1943             :     // ensure that std::char_traits<char>::eof() and the character 0xFF do not
    1944             :     // end up as the same value, eg. 0xFFFFFFFF.
    1945        8426 :     std::char_traits<char>::int_type get_character() override
    1946             :     {
    1947        8426 :         return sb.sbumpc();
    1948             :     }
    1949             : 
    1950           0 :     void unget_character() override
    1951             :     {
    1952           0 :         sb.sungetc(); // is.unget() avoided for performance
    1953           0 :     }
    1954             : 
    1955             : private:
    1956             :     /// the associated input stream
    1957             :     std::istream& is;
    1958             :     std::streambuf& sb;
    1959             : };
    1960             : 
    1961             : /// input adapter for buffer input
    1962             : class input_buffer_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
    1963             : {
    1964             : public:
    1965             :     input_buffer_adapter(const char* b, const std::size_t l)
    1966             :         : cursor(b)
    1967             :         , limit(b + l)
    1968             :         , start(b)
    1969             :     {
    1970             :         // skip byte order mark
    1971             :         if (l >= 3 and b[0] == '\xEF' and b[1] == '\xBB' and b[2] == '\xBF')
    1972             :         {
    1973             :             cursor += 3;
    1974             :         }
    1975             :     }
    1976             : 
    1977             :     // delete because of pointer members
    1978             :     input_buffer_adapter(const input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
    1979             :     input_buffer_adapter& operator=(input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
    1980             : 
    1981             :     std::char_traits<char>::int_type get_character() noexcept override
    1982             :     {
    1983             :         if (JSON_LIKELY(cursor < limit))
    1984             :         {
    1985             :             return std::char_traits<char>::to_int_type(*(cursor++));
    1986             :         }
    1987             : 
    1988             :         return std::char_traits<char>::eof();
    1989             :     }
    1990             : 
    1991             :     void unget_character() noexcept override
    1992             :     {
    1993             :         if (JSON_LIKELY(cursor > start))
    1994             :         {
    1995             :             --cursor;
    1996             :         }
    1997             :     }
    1998             : 
    1999             : private:
    2000             :     /// pointer to the current character
    2001             :     const char* cursor;
    2002             :     /// pointer past the last character
    2003             :     const char* limit;
    2004             :     /// pointer to the first character
    2005             :     const char* start;
    2006             : };
    2007             : 
    2008          11 : class input_adapter
    2009             : {
    2010             : public:
    2011             :     // native support
    2012             : 
    2013             :     /// input adapter for input stream
    2014          11 :     input_adapter(std::istream& i)
    2015          11 :         : ia(std::make_shared<input_stream_adapter>(i))
    2016             :     {
    2017          11 :     }
    2018             : 
    2019             :     /// input adapter for input stream
    2020             :     input_adapter(std::istream&& i)
    2021             :         : ia(std::make_shared<input_stream_adapter>(i))
    2022             :     {
    2023             :     }
    2024             : 
    2025             :     /// input adapter for buffer
    2026             :     template <typename CharT,
    2027             :               typename std::enable_if<
    2028             :                   std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
    2029             :                       std::is_integral<
    2030             :                           typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
    2031             :                       sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1,
    2032             :                   int>::type = 0>
    2033             :     input_adapter(CharT b, std::size_t l)
    2034             :         : ia(std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(
    2035             :               reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b), l))
    2036             :     {
    2037             :     }
    2038             : 
    2039             :     // derived support
    2040             : 
    2041             :     /// input adapter for string literal
    2042             :     template <typename CharT,
    2043             :               typename std::enable_if<
    2044             :                   std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
    2045             :                       std::is_integral<
    2046             :                           typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
    2047             :                       sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1,
    2048             :                   int>::type = 0>
    2049             :     input_adapter(CharT b)
    2050             :         : input_adapter(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b),
    2051             :                         std::strlen(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b)))
    2052             :     {
    2053             :     }
    2054             : 
    2055             :     /// input adapter for iterator range with contiguous storage
    2056             :     template <class IteratorType,
    2057             :               typename std::enable_if<
    2058             :                   std::is_same<typename std::iterator_traits<
    2059             :                                    IteratorType>::iterator_category,
    2060             :                                std::random_access_iterator_tag>::value,
    2061             :                   int>::type = 0>
    2062             :     input_adapter(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
    2063             :     {
    2064             :         // assertion to check that the iterator range is indeed contiguous,
    2065             :         // see http://stackoverflow.com/a/35008842/266378 for more discussion
    2066             :         assert(std::accumulate(
    2067             :                    first, last, std::pair<bool, int>(true, 0),
    2068             :                    [&first](std::pair<bool, int> res, decltype(*first) val) {
    2069             :                        res.first &=
    2070             :                            (val ==
    2071             :                             *(std::next(std::addressof(*first), res.second++)));
    2072             :                        return res;
    2073             :                    })
    2074             :                    .first);
    2075             : 
    2076             :         // assertion to check that each element is 1 byte long
    2077             :         static_assert(
    2078             :             sizeof(typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type) ==
    2079             :                 1,
    2080             :             "each element in the iterator range must have the size of 1 byte");
    2081             : 
    2082             :         const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(first, last));
    2083             :         if (JSON_LIKELY(len > 0))
    2084             :         {
    2085             :             // there is at least one element: use the address of first
    2086             :             ia = std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(
    2087             :                 reinterpret_cast<const char*>(&(*first)), len);
    2088             :         }
    2089             :         else
    2090             :         {
    2091             :             // the address of first cannot be used: use nullptr
    2092             :             ia = std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(nullptr, len);
    2093             :         }
    2094             :     }
    2095             : 
    2096             :     /// input adapter for array
    2097             :     template <class T, std::size_t N>
    2098             :     input_adapter(T (&array)[N])
    2099             :         : input_adapter(std::begin(array), std::end(array))
    2100             :     {
    2101             :     }
    2102             : 
    2103             :     /// input adapter for contiguous container
    2104             :     template <class ContiguousContainer,
    2105             :               typename std::enable_if<
    2106             :                   not std::is_pointer<ContiguousContainer>::value and
    2107             :                       std::is_base_of<
    2108             :                           std::random_access_iterator_tag,
    2109             :                           typename std::iterator_traits<decltype(std::begin(
    2110             :                               std::declval<ContiguousContainer const>()))>::
    2111             :                               iterator_category>::value,
    2112             :                   int>::type = 0>
    2113             :     input_adapter(const ContiguousContainer& c)
    2114             :         : input_adapter(std::begin(c), std::end(c))
    2115             :     {
    2116             :     }
    2117             : 
    2118          11 :     operator input_adapter_t() { return ia; }
    2119             : private:
    2120             :     /// the actual adapter
    2121             :     input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
    2122             : };
    2123             : }
    2124             : }
    2125             : 
    2126             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/lexer.hpp>

    2146             : ///////////
    2147             : // lexer //
    2148             : ///////////
    2149             : 
    2150             : /*!
    2151             : @brief lexical analysis
    2152             : 
    2153             : This class organizes the lexical analysis during JSON deserialization.
    2154             : */
    2155             : template <typename BasicJsonType>
    2156          11 : class lexer
    2157             : {
    2158             :     using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
    2159             :     using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
    2160             :     using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
    2161             :     using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
    2162             : 
    2163             : public:
    2164             :     /// token types for the parser
    2165             :     enum class token_type
    2166             :     {
    2167             :         uninitialized,  ///< indicating the scanner is uninitialized
    2168             :         literal_true,   ///< the `true` literal
    2169             :         literal_false,  ///< the `false` literal
    2170             :         literal_null,   ///< the `null` literal
    2171             :         value_string,   ///< a string -- use get_string() for actual value
    2172             :         value_unsigned, ///< an unsigned integer -- use get_number_unsigned()
    2173             :                         /// for actual value
    2174             :         value_integer,  ///< a signed integer -- use get_number_integer() for
    2175             :                         /// actual value
    2176             :         value_float, ///< an floating point number -- use get_number_float() for
    2177             :                      /// actual value
    2178             :         begin_array, ///< the character for array begin `[`
    2179             :         begin_object,    ///< the character for object begin `{`
    2180             :         end_array,       ///< the character for array end `]`
    2181             :         end_object,      ///< the character for object end `}`
    2182             :         name_separator,  ///< the name separator `:`
    2183             :         value_separator, ///< the value separator `,`
    2184             :         parse_error,     ///< indicating a parse error
    2185             :         end_of_input,    ///< indicating the end of the input buffer
    2186             :         literal_or_value ///< a literal or the begin of a value (only for
    2187             :                          /// diagnostics)
    2188             :     };
    2189             : 
    2190             :     /// return name of values of type token_type (only used for errors)
    2191           0 :     static const char* token_type_name(const token_type t) noexcept
    2192             :     {
    2193           0 :         switch (t)
    2194             :         {
    2195             :         case token_type::uninitialized:
    2196           0 :             return "<uninitialized>";
    2197             :         case token_type::literal_true:
    2198           0 :             return "true literal";
    2199             :         case token_type::literal_false:
    2200           0 :             return "false literal";
    2201             :         case token_type::literal_null:
    2202           0 :             return "null literal";
    2203             :         case token_type::value_string:
    2204           0 :             return "string literal";
    2205             :         case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned:
    2206             :         case lexer::token_type::value_integer:
    2207             :         case lexer::token_type::value_float:
    2208           0 :             return "number literal";
    2209             :         case token_type::begin_array:
    2210           0 :             return "'['";
    2211             :         case token_type::begin_object:
    2212           0 :             return "'{'";
    2213             :         case token_type::end_array:
    2214           0 :             return "']'";
    2215             :         case token_type::end_object:
    2216           0 :             return "'}'";
    2217             :         case token_type::name_separator:
    2218           0 :             return "':'";
    2219             :         case token_type::value_separator:
    2220           0 :             return "','";
    2221             :         case token_type::parse_error:
    2222           0 :             return "<parse error>";
    2223             :         case token_type::end_of_input:
    2224           0 :             return "end of input";
    2225             :         case token_type::literal_or_value:
    2226           0 :             return "'[', '{', or a literal";
    2227             :         default:                    // catch non-enum values
    2228             :             return "unknown token"; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
    2229             :         }
    2230             :     }
    2231             : 
    2232          11 :     explicit lexer(detail::input_adapter_t adapter)

    2234          22 :         , decimal_point_char(get_decimal_point())

    2243             :     /////////////////////
    2244             :     // locales
    2245             :     /////////////////////
    2246             : 
    2247             :     /// return the locale-dependent decimal point
    2248          11 :     static char get_decimal_point() noexcept
    2249             :     {
    2250          11 :         const auto loc = localeconv();
    2251          11 :         assert(loc != nullptr);
    2252          11 :         return (loc->decimal_point == nullptr) ? '.' : *(loc->decimal_point);
    2253             :     }
    2254             : 
    2255             :     /////////////////////
    2256             :     // scan functions
    2257             :     /////////////////////
    2258             : 
    2259             :     /*!
    2260             :     @brief get codepoint from 4 hex characters following `\u`
    2261             : 
    2262             :     For input "\u c1 c2 c3 c4" the codepoint is:
    2263             :       (c1 * 0x1000) + (c2 * 0x0100) + (c3 * 0x0010) + c4
    2264             :     = (c1 << 12) + (c2 << 8) + (c3 << 4) + (c4 << 0)
    2265             : 
    2266             :     Furthermore, the possible characters '0'..'9', 'A'..'F', and 'a'..'f'
    2267             :     must be converted to the integers 0x0..0x9, 0xA..0xF, 0xA..0xF, resp. The
    2268             :     conversion is done by subtracting the offset (0x30, 0x37, and 0x57)
    2269             :     between the ASCII value of the character and the desired integer value.
    2270             : 
    2271             :     @return codepoint (0x0000..0xFFFF) or -1 in case of an error (e.g. EOF or
    2272             :             non-hex character)
    2273             :     */
    2274           0 :     int get_codepoint()
    2275             :     {
    2276             :         // this function only makes sense after reading `\u`
    2277           0 :         assert(current == 'u');
    2278           0 :         int codepoint = 0;
    2279             : 
    2280           0 :         const auto factors = {12, 8, 4, 0};
    2281           0 :         for (const auto factor : factors)
    2282             :         {
    2283           0 :             get();
    2284             : 
    2285           0 :             if (current >= '0' and current <= '9')
    2286             :             {
    2287           0 :                 codepoint += ((current - 0x30) << factor);
    2288             :             }
    2289           0 :             else if (current >= 'A' and current <= 'F')
    2290             :             {
    2291           0 :                 codepoint += ((current - 0x37) << factor);
    2292             :             }
    2293           0 :             else if (current >= 'a' and current <= 'f')
    2294             :             {
    2295           0 :                 codepoint += ((current - 0x57) << factor);
    2296             :             }
    2297             :             else
    2298             :             {
    2299           0 :                 return -1;
    2300             :             }
    2301             :         }
    2302             : 
    2303           0 :         assert(0x0000 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0xFFFF);
    2304           0 :         return codepoint;
    2305             :     }
    2306             : 
    2307             :     /*!
    2308             :     @brief check if the next byte(s) are inside a given range
    2309             : 
    2310             :     Adds the current byte and, for each passed range, reads a new byte and
    2311             :     checks if it is inside the range. If a violation was detected, set up an
    2312             :     error message and return false. Otherwise, return true.
    2313             : 
    2314             :     @param[in] ranges  list of integers; interpreted as list of pairs of
    2315             :                        inclusive lower and upper bound, respectively
    2316             : 
    2317             :     @pre The passed list @a ranges must have 2, 4, or 6 elements; that is,
    2318             :          1, 2, or 3 pairs. This precondition is enforced by an assertion.
    2319             : 
    2320             :     @return true if and only if no range violation was detected
    2321             :     */
    2322           0 :     bool next_byte_in_range(std::initializer_list<int> ranges)
    2323             :     {
    2324           0 :         assert(ranges.size() == 2 or ranges.size() == 4 or ranges.size() == 6);
    2325           0 :         add(current);
    2326             : 
    2327           0 :         for (auto range = ranges.begin(); range != ranges.end(); ++range)
    2328             :         {
    2329           0 :             get();
    2330           0 :             if (JSON_LIKELY(*range <= current and current <= *(++range)))
    2331             :             {
    2332           0 :                 add(current);
    2333             :             }
    2334             :             else
    2335             :             {
    2336           0 :                 error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
    2337           0 :                 return false;
    2338             :             }
    2339             :         }
    2340             : 
    2341           0 :         return true;
    2342             :     }
    2343             : 
    2344             :     /*!
    2345             :     @brief scan a string literal
    2346             : 
    2347             :     This function scans a string according to Sect. 7 of RFC 7159. While
    2348             :     scanning, bytes are escaped and copied into buffer token_buffer. Then the
    2349             :     function returns successfully, token_buffer is *not* null-terminated (as it
    2350             :     may contain \0 bytes), and token_buffer.size() is the number of bytes in the
    2351             :     string.
    2352             : 
    2353             :     @return token_type::value_string if string could be successfully scanned,
    2354             :             token_type::parse_error otherwise
    2355             : 
    2356             :     @note In case of errors, variable error_message contains a textual
    2357             :           description.
    2358             :     */
    2359         297 :     token_type scan_string()
    2360             :     {
    2361             :         // reset token_buffer (ignore opening quote)
    2362         297 :         reset();
    2363             : 
    2364             :         // we entered the function by reading an open quote
    2365         297 :         assert(current == '\"');
    2366             : 
    2367        4037 :         while (true)
    2368             :         {
    2369             :             // get next character
    2370        4334 :             switch (get())
    2371             :             {
    2372             :             // end of file while parsing string
    2373             :             case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
    2374             :             {
    2375           0 :                 error_message = "invalid string: missing closing quote";
    2376           0 :                 return token_type::parse_error;
    2377             :             }
    2378             : 
    2379             :             // closing quote
    2380             :             case '\"':
    2381             :             {
    2382         297 :                 return token_type::value_string;
    2383             :             }
    2384             : 
    2385             :             // escapes
    2386             :             case '\\':
    2387             :             {
    2388           0 :                 switch (get())
    2389             :                 {
    2390             :                 // quotation mark
    2391             :                 case '\"':
    2392           0 :                     add('\"');
    2393           0 :                     break;
    2394             :                 // reverse solidus
    2395             :                 case '\\':
    2396           0 :                     add('\\');
    2397           0 :                     break;
    2398             :                 // solidus
    2399             :                 case '/':
    2400           0 :                     add('/');
    2401           0 :                     break;
    2402             :                 // backspace
    2403             :                 case 'b':
    2404           0 :                     add('\b');
    2405           0 :                     break;
    2406             :                 // form feed
    2407             :                 case 'f':
    2408           0 :                     add('\f');
    2409           0 :                     break;
    2410             :                 // line feed
    2411             :                 case 'n':
    2412           0 :                     add('\n');
    2413           0 :                     break;
    2414             :                 // carriage return
    2415             :                 case 'r':
    2416           0 :                     add('\r');
    2417           0 :                     break;
    2418             :                 // tab
    2419             :                 case 't':
    2420           0 :                     add('\t');
    2421           0 :                     break;
    2422             : 
    2423             :                 // unicode escapes
    2424             :                 case 'u':
    2425             :                 {
    2426           0 :                     const int codepoint1 = get_codepoint();
    2427           0 :                     int codepoint = codepoint1; // start with codepoint1
    2428             : 
    2429           0 :                     if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint1 == -1))
    2430             :                     {
    2431           0 :                         error_message =
    2432             :                             "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex "
    2433             :                             "digits";
    2434           0 :                         return token_type::parse_error;
    2435             :                     }
    2436             : 
    2437             :                     // check if code point is a high surrogate
    2438           0 :                     if (0xD800 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDBFF)
    2439             :                     {
    2440             :                         // expect next \uxxxx entry
    2441           0 :                         if (JSON_LIKELY(get() == '\\' and get() == 'u'))
    2442             :                         {
    2443           0 :                             const int codepoint2 = get_codepoint();
    2444             : 
    2445           0 :                             if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint2 == -1))
    2446             :                             {
    2447           0 :                                 error_message =
    2448             :                                     "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by "
    2449             :                                     "4 hex digits";
    2450           0 :                                 return token_type::parse_error;
    2451             :                             }
    2452             : 
    2453             :                             // check if codepoint2 is a low surrogate
    2454           0 :                             if (JSON_LIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint2 and
    2455             :                                             codepoint2 <= 0xDFFF))
    2456             :                             {
    2457             :                                 // overwrite codepoint
    2458           0 :                                 codepoint =
    2459             :                                     // high surrogate occupies the most
    2460             :                                     // significant 22 bits
    2461           0 :                                     (codepoint1 << 10)
    2462             :                                     // low surrogate occupies the least
    2463             :                                     // significant 15 bits
    2464           0 :                                     + codepoint2
    2465             :                                     // there is still the 0xD800, 0xDC00 and
    2466             :                                     // 0x10000 noise
    2467             :                                     // in the result so we have to subtract
    2468             :                                     // with:
    2469             :                                     // (0xD800 << 10) + DC00 - 0x10000 =
    2470             :                                     // 0x35FDC00
    2471             :                                     - 0x35FDC00;
    2472             :                             }
    2473             :                             else
    2474             :                             {
    2475           0 :                                 error_message =
    2476             :                                     "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF "
    2477             :                                     "must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
    2478           0 :                                 return token_type::parse_error;
    2479             :                             }
    2480             :                         }
    2481             :                         else
    2482             :                         {
    2483           0 :                             error_message =
    2484             :                                 "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must "
    2485             :                                 "be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
    2486           0 :                             return token_type::parse_error;
    2487           0 :                         }
    2488             :                     }
    2489             :                     else
    2490             :                     {
    2491           0 :                         if (JSON_UNLIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint1 and
    2492             :                                           codepoint1 <= 0xDFFF))
    2493             :                         {
    2494           0 :                             error_message =
    2495             :                                 "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must "
    2496             :                                 "follow U+D800..U+DBFF";
    2497           0 :                             return token_type::parse_error;
    2498             :                         }
    2499             :                     }
    2500             : 
    2501             :                     // result of the above calculation yields a proper codepoint
    2502           0 :                     assert(0x00 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
    2503             : 
    2504             :                     // translate codepoint into bytes
    2505           0 :                     if (codepoint < 0x80)
    2506             :                     {
    2507             :                         // 1-byte characters: 0xxxxxxx (ASCII)
    2508           0 :                         add(codepoint);
    2509             :                     }
    2510           0 :                     else if (codepoint <= 0x7FF)
    2511             :                     {
    2512             :                         // 2-byte characters: 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
    2513           0 :                         add(0xC0 | (codepoint >> 6));
    2514           0 :                         add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
    2515             :                     }
    2516           0 :                     else if (codepoint <= 0xFFFF)
    2517             :                     {
    2518             :                         // 3-byte characters: 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
    2519           0 :                         add(0xE0 | (codepoint >> 12));
    2520           0 :                         add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
    2521           0 :                         add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
    2522             :                     }
    2523             :                     else
    2524             :                     {
    2525             :                         // 4-byte characters: 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
    2526             :                         // 10xxxxxx
    2527           0 :                         add(0xF0 | (codepoint >> 18));
    2528           0 :                         add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x3F));
    2529           0 :                         add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
    2530           0 :                         add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
    2531             :                     }
    2532             : 
    2533           0 :                     break;
    2534             :                 }
    2535             : 
    2536             :                 // other characters after escape
    2537             :                 default:
    2538           0 :                     error_message =
    2539             :                         "invalid string: forbidden character after backslash";
    2540           0 :                     return token_type::parse_error;
    2541             :                 }
    2542             : 
    2543           0 :                 break;
    2544             :             }

    2547             :             case 0x00:

    2641             :             case 0x58:

    2666             :             case 0x72:
    2667             :             case 0x73:
    2668             :             case 0x74:
    2669             :             case 0x75:
    2670             :             case 0x76:
    2671             :             case 0x77:
    2672             :             case 0x78:
    2673             :             case 0x79:
    2674             :             case 0x7A:
    2675             :             case 0x7B:
    2676             :             case 0x7C:
    2677             :             case 0x7D:
    2678             :             case 0x7E:
    2679             :             case 0x7F:
    2680             :             {
    2681        4037 :                 add(current);
    2682        4037 :                 break;
    2683             :             }
    2684             : 
    2685             :             // U+0080..U+07FF: bytes C2..DF 80..BF
    2686             :             case 0xC2:
    2687             :             case 0xC3:
    2688             :             case 0xC4:
    2689             :             case 0xC5:
    2690             :             case 0xC6:
    2691             :             case 0xC7:
    2692             :             case 0xC8:
    2693             :             case 0xC9:
    2694             :             case 0xCA:
    2695             :             case 0xCB:
    2696             :             case 0xCC:
    2697             :             case 0xCD:
    2698             :             case 0xCE:
    2699             :             case 0xCF:
    2700             :             case 0xD0:
    2701             :             case 0xD1:
    2702             :             case 0xD2:
    2703             :             case 0xD3:
    2704             :             case 0xD4:
    2705             :             case 0xD5:
    2706             :             case 0xD6:
    2707             :             case 0xD7:
    2708             :             case 0xD8:
    2709             :             case 0xD9:
    2710             :             case 0xDA:
    2711             :             case 0xDB:
    2712             :             case 0xDC:
    2713             :             case 0xDD:
    2714             :             case 0xDE:
    2715             :             case 0xDF:
    2716             :             {
    2717           0 :                 if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF})))
    2718             :                 {
    2719           0 :                     return token_type::parse_error;
    2720             :                 }
    2721           0 :                 break;
    2722             :             }
    2723             : 
    2724             :             // U+0800..U+0FFF: bytes E0 A0..BF 80..BF
    2725             :             case 0xE0:
    2726             :             {
    2727           0 :                 if (JSON_UNLIKELY(
    2728             :                         not(next_byte_in_range({0xA0, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
    2729             :                 {
    2730           0 :                     return token_type::parse_error;
    2731             :                 }
    2732           0 :                 break;
    2733             :             }
    2734             : 
    2735             :             // U+1000..U+CFFF: bytes E1..EC 80..BF 80..BF
    2736             :             // U+E000..U+FFFF: bytes EE..EF 80..BF 80..BF
    2737             :             case 0xE1:
    2738             :             case 0xE2:
    2739             :             case 0xE3:
    2740             :             case 0xE4:
    2741             :             case 0xE5:
    2742             :             case 0xE6:
    2743             :             case 0xE7:
    2744             :             case 0xE8:
    2745             :             case 0xE9:
    2746             :             case 0xEA:
    2747             :             case 0xEB:
    2748             :             case 0xEC:
    2749             :             case 0xEE:
    2750             :             case 0xEF:
    2751             :             {
    2752           0 :                 if (JSON_UNLIKELY(
    2753             :                         not(next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
    2754             :                 {
    2755           0 :                     return token_type::parse_error;
    2756             :                 }
    2757           0 :                 break;
    2758             :             }
    2759             : 
    2760             :             // U+D000..U+D7FF: bytes ED 80..9F 80..BF
    2761             :             case 0xED:
    2762             :             {
    2763           0 :                 if (JSON_UNLIKELY(
    2764             :                         not(next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0x9F, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
    2765             :                 {
    2766           0 :                     return token_type::parse_error;
    2767             :                 }
    2768           0 :                 break;
    2769             :             }
    2770             : 
    2771             :             // U+10000..U+3FFFF F0 90..BF 80..BF 80..BF
    2772             :             case 0xF0:
    2773             :             {
    2774           0 :                 if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(next_byte_in_range(
    2775             :                         {0x90, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
    2776             :                 {
    2777           0 :                     return token_type::parse_error;
    2778             :                 }
    2779           0 :                 break;
    2780             :             }
    2781             : 
    2782             :             // U+40000..U+FFFFF F1..F3 80..BF 80..BF 80..BF
    2783             :             case 0xF1:
    2784             :             case 0xF2:
    2785             :             case 0xF3:
    2786             :             {
    2787           0 :                 if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(next_byte_in_range(
    2788             :                         {0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
    2789             :                 {
    2790           0 :                     return token_type::parse_error;
    2791             :                 }
    2792           0 :                 break;
    2793             :             }
    2794             : 
    2795             :             // U+100000..U+10FFFF F4 80..8F 80..BF 80..BF
    2796             :             case 0xF4:
    2797             :             {
    2798           0 :                 if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(next_byte_in_range(
    2799             :                         {0x80, 0x8F, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
    2800             :                 {
    2801           0 :                     return token_type::parse_error;
    2802             :                 }
    2803           0 :                 break;
    2804             :             }
    2805             : 
    2806             :             // remaining bytes (80..C1 and F5..FF) are ill-formed
    2807             :             default:
    2808             :             {
    2809           0 :                 error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
    2810           0 :                 return token_type::parse_error;
    2811             :             }
    2812             :             }
    2813             :         }
    2814             :     }
    2815             : 
    2816             :     static void strtof(float& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
    2817             :     {
    2818             :         f = std::strtof(str, endptr);
    2819             :     }
    2820             : 
    2821           0 :     static void strtof(double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
    2822             :     {
    2823           0 :         f = std::strtod(str, endptr);
    2824           0 :     }
    2825             : 
    2826             :     static void strtof(long double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
    2827             :     {
    2828             :         f = std::strtold(str, endptr);
    2829             :     }
    2830             : 
    2831             :     /*!
    2832             :     @brief scan a number literal
    2833             : 
    2834             :     This function scans a string according to Sect. 6 of RFC 7159.
    2835             : 
    2836             :     The function is realized with a deterministic finite state machine derived
    2837             :     from the grammar described in RFC 7159. Starting in state "init", the
    2838             :     input is read and used to determined the next state. Only state "done"
    2839             :     accepts the number. State "error" is a trap state to model errors. In the
    2840             :     table below, "anything" means any character but the ones listed before.
    2841             : 
    2842             :     state    | 0        | 1-9      | e E      | +       | -       | .        |
    2843             :     anything
    2844             :     ---------|----------|----------|----------|---------|---------|----------|-----------
    2845             :     init     | zero     | any1     | [error]  | [error] | minus   | [error]  |
    2846             :     [error]
    2847             :     minus    | zero     | any1     | [error]  | [error] | [error] | [error]  |
    2848             :     [error]
    2849             :     zero     | done     | done     | exponent | done    | done    | decimal1 |
    2850             :     done
    2851             :     any1     | any1     | any1     | exponent | done    | done    | decimal1 |
    2852             :     done
    2853             :     decimal1 | decimal2 | [error]  | [error]  | [error] | [error] | [error]  |
    2854             :     [error]
    2855             :     decimal2 | decimal2 | decimal2 | exponent | done    | done    | done     |
    2856             :     done
    2857             :     exponent | any2     | any2     | [error]  | sign    | sign    | [error]  |
    2858             :     [error]
    2859             :     sign     | any2     | any2     | [error]  | [error] | [error] | [error]  |
    2860             :     [error]
    2861             :     any2     | any2     | any2     | done     | done    | done    | done     |
    2862             :     done
    2863             : 
    2864             :     The state machine is realized with one label per state (prefixed with
    2865             :     "scan_number_") and `goto` statements between them. The state machine
    2866             :     contains cycles, but any cycle can be left when EOF is read. Therefore,
    2867             :     the function is guaranteed to terminate.
    2868             : 
    2869             :     During scanning, the read bytes are stored in token_buffer. This string is
    2870             :     then converted to a signed integer, an unsigned integer, or a
    2871             :     floating-point number.
    2872             : 
    2873             :     @return token_type::value_unsigned, token_type::value_integer, or
    2874             :             token_type::value_float if number could be successfully scanned,
    2875             :             token_type::parse_error otherwise
    2876             : 
    2877             :     @note The scanner is independent of the current locale. Internally, the
    2878             :           locale's decimal point is used instead of `.` to work with the
    2879             :           locale-dependent converters.
    2880             :     */
    2881           0 :     token_type scan_number()
    2882             :     {
    2883             :         // reset token_buffer to store the number's bytes
    2884           0 :         reset();
    2885             : 
    2886             :         // the type of the parsed number; initially set to unsigned; will be
    2887             :         // changed if minus sign, decimal point or exponent is read
    2888           0 :         token_type number_type = token_type::value_unsigned;
    2889             : 
    2890             :         // state (init): we just found out we need to scan a number
    2891           0 :         switch (current)
    2892             :         {
    2893             :         case '-':
    2894             :         {
    2895           0 :             add(current);
    2896           0 :             goto scan_number_minus;
    2897             :         }
    2898             : 
    2899             :         case '0':
    2900             :         {
    2901           0 :             add(current);
    2902           0 :             goto scan_number_zero;
    2903             :         }
    2904             : 
    2905             :         case '1':
    2906             :         case '2':
    2907             :         case '3':
    2908             :         case '4':
    2909             :         case '5':
    2910             :         case '6':
    2911             :         case '7':
    2912             :         case '8':
    2913             :         case '9':
    2914             :         {
    2915           0 :             add(current);
    2916           0 :             goto scan_number_any1;
    2917             :         }
    2918             : 
    2919             :         default:
    2920             :         {
    2921             :             // all other characters are rejected outside scan_number()
    2922             :             assert(false); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
    2923             :         }
    2924             :         }
    2925             : 
    2926             :     scan_number_minus:
    2927             :         // state: we just parsed a leading minus sign
    2928           0 :         number_type = token_type::value_integer;
    2929           0 :         switch (get())
    2930             :         {
    2931             :         case '0':
    2932             :         {
    2933           0 :             add(current);
    2934           0 :             goto scan_number_zero;
    2935             :         }
    2936             : 
    2937             :         case '1':
    2938             :         case '2':
    2939             :         case '3':
    2940             :         case '4':
    2941             :         case '5':
    2942             :         case '6':
    2943             :         case '7':
    2944             :         case '8':
    2945             :         case '9':
    2946             :         {
    2947           0 :             add(current);
    2948           0 :             goto scan_number_any1;
    2949             :         }
    2950             : 
    2951             :         default:
    2952             :         {
    2953           0 :             error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '-'";
    2954           0 :             return token_type::parse_error;
    2955             :         }
    2956             :         }
    2957             : 
    2958             :     scan_number_zero:
    2959             :         // state: we just parse a zero (maybe with a leading minus sign)
    2960           0 :         switch (get())
    2961             :         {
    2962             :         case '.':
    2963             :         {
    2964           0 :             add(decimal_point_char);
    2965           0 :             goto scan_number_decimal1;
    2966             :         }
    2967             : 
    2968             :         case 'e':
    2969             :         case 'E':
    2970             :         {
    2971           0 :             add(current);
    2972           0 :             goto scan_number_exponent;
    2973             :         }
    2974             : 
    2975             :         default:
    2976           0 :             goto scan_number_done;
    2977             :         }
    2978             : 
    2979             :     scan_number_any1:
    2980             :         // state: we just parsed a number 0-9 (maybe with a leading minus sign)
    2981           0 :         switch (get())
    2982             :         {
    2983             :         case '0':
    2984             :         case '1':
    2985             :         case '2':
    2986             :         case '3':
    2987             :         case '4':
    2988             :         case '5':
    2989             :         case '6':
    2990             :         case '7':
    2991             :         case '8':
    2992             :         case '9':
    2993             :         {
    2994           0 :             add(current);
    2995           0 :             goto scan_number_any1;
    2996             :         }
    2997             : 
    2998             :         case '.':
    2999             :         {
    3000           0 :             add(decimal_point_char);
    3001           0 :             goto scan_number_decimal1;
    3002             :         }
    3003             : 
    3004             :         case 'e':
    3005             :         case 'E':
    3006             :         {
    3007           0 :             add(current);
    3008           0 :             goto scan_number_exponent;
    3009             :         }
    3010             : 
    3011             :         default:
    3012           0 :             goto scan_number_done;
    3013             :         }
    3014             : 
    3015             :     scan_number_decimal1:
    3016             :         // state: we just parsed a decimal point
    3017           0 :         number_type = token_type::value_float;
    3018           0 :         switch (get())
    3019             :         {
    3020             :         case '0':
    3021             :         case '1':
    3022             :         case '2':
    3023             :         case '3':
    3024             :         case '4':
    3025             :         case '5':
    3026             :         case '6':
    3027             :         case '7':
    3028             :         case '8':
    3029             :         case '9':
    3030             :         {
    3031           0 :             add(current);
    3032           0 :             goto scan_number_decimal2;
    3033             :         }
    3034             : 
    3035             :         default:
    3036             :         {
    3037           0 :             error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '.'";
    3038           0 :             return token_type::parse_error;
    3039             :         }
    3040             :         }
    3041             : 
    3042             :     scan_number_decimal2:
    3043             :         // we just parsed at least one number after a decimal point
    3044           0 :         switch (get())
    3045             :         {
    3046             :         case '0':
    3047             :         case '1':
    3048             :         case '2':
    3049             :         case '3':
    3050             :         case '4':
    3051             :         case '5':
    3052             :         case '6':
    3053             :         case '7':
    3054             :         case '8':
    3055             :         case '9':
    3056             :         {
    3057           0 :             add(current);
    3058           0 :             goto scan_number_decimal2;
    3059             :         }
    3060             : 
    3061             :         case 'e':
    3062             :         case 'E':
    3063             :         {
    3064           0 :             add(current);
    3065           0 :             goto scan_number_exponent;
    3066             :         }
    3067             : 
    3068             :         default:
    3069           0 :             goto scan_number_done;
    3070             :         }
    3071             : 
    3072             :     scan_number_exponent:
    3073             :         // we just parsed an exponent
    3074           0 :         number_type = token_type::value_float;
    3075           0 :         switch (get())
    3076             :         {
    3077             :         case '+':
    3078             :         case '-':
    3079             :         {
    3080           0 :             add(current);
    3081           0 :             goto scan_number_sign;
    3082             :         }
    3083             : 
    3084             :         case '0':
    3085             :         case '1':
    3086             :         case '2':
    3087             :         case '3':
    3088             :         case '4':
    3089             :         case '5':
    3090             :         case '6':
    3091             :         case '7':
    3092             :         case '8':
    3093             :         case '9':
    3094             :         {
    3095           0 :             add(current);
    3096           0 :             goto scan_number_any2;
    3097             :         }
    3098             : 
    3099             :         default:
    3100             :         {
    3101           0 :             error_message =
    3102             :                 "invalid number; expected '+', '-', or digit after exponent";
    3103           0 :             return token_type::parse_error;
    3104             :         }
    3105             :         }
    3106             : 
    3107             :     scan_number_sign:
    3108             :         // we just parsed an exponent sign
    3109           0 :         switch (get())
    3110             :         {
    3111             :         case '0':
    3112             :         case '1':
    3113             :         case '2':
    3114             :         case '3':
    3115             :         case '4':
    3116             :         case '5':
    3117             :         case '6':
    3118             :         case '7':
    3119             :         case '8':
    3120             :         case '9':
    3121             :         {
    3122           0 :             add(current);
    3123           0 :             goto scan_number_any2;
    3124             :         }
    3125             : 
    3126             :         default:
    3127             :         {
    3128           0 :             error_message =
    3129             :                 "invalid number; expected digit after exponent sign";
    3130           0 :             return token_type::parse_error;
    3131             :         }
    3132             :         }
    3133             : 
    3134             :     scan_number_any2:
    3135             :         // we just parsed a number after the exponent or exponent sign
    3136           0 :         switch (get())
    3137             :         {
    3138             :         case '0':
    3139             :         case '1':
    3140             :         case '2':
    3141             :         case '3':
    3142             :         case '4':
    3143             :         case '5':
    3144             :         case '6':
    3145             :         case '7':
    3146             :         case '8':
    3147             :         case '9':
    3148             :         {
    3149           0 :             add(current);
    3150           0 :             goto scan_number_any2;
    3151             :         }
    3152             : 
    3153             :         default:
    3154           0 :             goto scan_number_done;
    3155             :         }
    3156             : 
    3157             :     scan_number_done:
    3158             :         // unget the character after the number (we only read it to know that
    3159             :         // we are done scanning a number)
    3160           0 :         unget();
    3161             : 
    3162           0 :         char* endptr = nullptr;
    3163           0 :         errno = 0;
    3164             : 
    3165             :         // try to parse integers first and fall back to floats
    3166           0 :         if (number_type == token_type::value_unsigned)
    3167             :         {
    3168           0 :             const auto x = std::strtoull(token_buffer.data(), &endptr, 10);
    3169             : 
    3170             :             // we checked the number format before
    3171           0 :             assert(endptr == token_buffer.data() + token_buffer.size());
    3172             : 
    3173           0 :             if (errno == 0)
    3174             :             {
    3175           0 :                 value_unsigned = static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(x);
    3176           0 :                 if (value_unsigned == x)
    3177             :                 {
    3178           0 :                     return token_type::value_unsigned;
    3179             :                 }
    3180             :             }
    3181             :         }
    3182           0 :         else if (number_type == token_type::value_integer)
    3183             :         {
    3184           0 :             const auto x = std::strtoll(token_buffer.data(), &endptr, 10);
    3185             : 
    3186             :             // we checked the number format before
    3187           0 :             assert(endptr == token_buffer.data() + token_buffer.size());
    3188             : 
    3189           0 :             if (errno == 0)
    3190             :             {
    3191           0 :                 value_integer = static_cast<number_integer_t>(x);
    3192           0 :                 if (value_integer == x)
    3193             :                 {
    3194           0 :                     return token_type::value_integer;
    3195             :                 }
    3196             :             }
    3197             :         }
    3198             : 
    3199             :         // this code is reached if we parse a floating-point number or if an
    3200             :         // integer conversion above failed
    3201           0 :         strtof(value_float, token_buffer.data(), &endptr);
    3202             : 
    3203             :         // we checked the number format before
    3204           0 :         assert(endptr == token_buffer.data() + token_buffer.size());
    3205             : 
    3206           0 :         return token_type::value_float;
    3207             :     }
    3208             : 
    3209             :     /*!
    3210             :     @param[in] literal_text  the literal text to expect
    3211             :     @param[in] length        the length of the passed literal text
    3212             :     @param[in] return_type   the token type to return on success
    3213             :     */
    3214           0 :     token_type scan_literal(const char* literal_text, const std::size_t length,
    3215             :                             token_type return_type)
    3216             :     {
    3217           0 :         assert(current == literal_text[0]);
    3218           0 :         for (std::size_t i = 1; i < length; ++i)
    3219             :         {
    3220           0 :             if (JSON_UNLIKELY(get() != literal_text[i]))
    3221             :             {
    3222           0 :                 error_message = "invalid literal";
    3223           0 :                 return token_type::parse_error;
    3224             :             }
    3225             :         }
    3226           0 :         return return_type;
    3227             :     }
    3228             : 
    3229             :     /////////////////////
    3230             :     // input management
    3231             :     /////////////////////
    3232             : 
    3233             :     /// reset token_buffer; current character is beginning of token
    3234         297 :     void reset() noexcept
    3235             :     {
    3236         297 :         token_buffer.clear();

    3238         297 :         token_string.push_back(std::char_traits<char>::to_char_type(current));
    3239         297 :     }
    3240             : 
    3241             :     /*
    3242             :     @brief get next character from the input
    3243             : 
    3244             :     This function provides the interface to the used input adapter. It does
    3245             :     not throw in case the input reached EOF, but returns a
    3246             :     `std::char_traits<char>::eof()` in that case.  Stores the scanned characters

    3257        8404 :             token_string.push_back(
    3258       16808 :                 std::char_traits<char>::to_char_type(current));
    3259             :         }
    3260        8415 :         return current;
    3261             :     }
    3262             : 
    3263             :     /// unget current character (return it again on next get)

    3265             :     {
    3266           0 :         --chars_read;
    3267           0 :         if (JSON_LIKELY(current != std::char_traits<char>::eof()))

    3278        4037 :         token_buffer.push_back(std::char_traits<char>::to_char_type(c));

    3472             : /*!
    3473             : @brief syntax analysis
    3474             : 
    3475             : This class implements a recursive decent parser.
    3476             : */
    3477             : template <typename BasicJsonType>
    3478          11 : class parser
    3479             : {
    3480             :     using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
    3481             :     using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
    3482             :     using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
    3483             :     using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
    3484             :     using lexer_t = lexer<BasicJsonType>;
    3485             :     using token_type = typename lexer_t::token_type;
    3486             : 
    3487             : public:
    3488             :     enum class parse_event_t : uint8_t
    3489             :     {
    3490             :         /// the parser read `{` and started to process a JSON object
    3491             :         object_start,
    3492             :         /// the parser read `}` and finished processing a JSON object
    3493             :         object_end,
    3494             :         /// the parser read `[` and started to process a JSON array
    3495             :         array_start,
    3496             :         /// the parser read `]` and finished processing a JSON array
    3497             :         array_end,
    3498             :         /// the parser read a key of a value in an object
    3499             :         key,
    3500             :         /// the parser finished reading a JSON value
    3501             :         value
    3502             :     };
    3503             : 
    3504             :     using parser_callback_t = std::function<bool(int depth, parse_event_t event,
    3505             :                                                  BasicJsonType& parsed)>;
    3506             : 
    3507             :     /// a parser reading from an input adapter
    3508          11 :     explicit parser(detail::input_adapter_t adapter,
    3509             :                     const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
    3510             :                     const bool allow_exceptions_ = true)

    3512             :         , m_lexer(adapter)
