    3515          11 :     }
    3516             : 
    3517             :     /*!
    3518             :     @brief public parser interface
    3519             : 
    3520             :     @param[in] strict      whether to expect the last token to be EOF
    3521             :     @param[in,out] result  parsed JSON value
    3522             : 
    3523             :     @throw parse_error.101 in case of an unexpected token
    3524             :     @throw parse_error.102 if to_unicode fails or surrogate error
    3525             :     @throw parse_error.103 if to_unicode fails
    3526             :     */
    3527          11 :     void parse(const bool strict, BasicJsonType& result)
    3528             :     {
    3529             :         // read first token
    3530          11 :         get_token();
    3531             : 
    3532          11 :         parse_internal(true, result);
    3533          11 :         result.assert_invariant();
    3534             : 
    3535             :         // in strict mode, input must be completely read
    3536          11 :         if (strict)
    3537             :         {
    3538          11 :             get_token();
    3539          11 :             expect(token_type::end_of_input);
    3540             :         }
    3541             : 
    3542             :         // in case of an error, return discarded value
    3543          11 :         if (errored)
    3544             :         {
    3545           0 :             result = value_t::discarded;
    3546           0 :             return;
    3547             :         }
    3548             : 
    3549             :         // set top-level value to null if it was discarded by the callback
    3550             :         // function
    3551          11 :         if (result.is_discarded())

    3553           0 :             result = nullptr;
    3554             :         }
    3555             :     }
    3556             : 
    3557             :     /*!

    3560             :     @param[in] strict  whether to expect the last token to be EOF
    3561             :     @return whether the input is a proper JSON text

    3565             :         // read first token
    3566             :         get_token();
    3567             : 
    3568             :         if (not accept_internal())
    3569             :         {
    3570             :             return false;
    3571             :         }
    3572             : 
    3573             :         // strict => last token must be EOF
    3574             :         return not strict or (get_token() == token_type::end_of_input);
    3575             :     }

    3584         220 :     void parse_internal(bool keep, BasicJsonType& result)
    3585             :     {
    3586             :         // never parse after a parse error was detected
    3587         220 :         assert(not errored);
    3588             : 
    3589             :         // start with a discarded value
    3590         220 :         if (not result.is_discarded())

    3830           0 :             if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not std::isfinite(result.m_value.number_float)))
    3831             :             {
    3832           0 :                 if (allow_exceptions)
    3833             :                 {
    3834           0 :                     JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(
    3835             :                         406, "number overflow parsing '" +
    3836             :                                  m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'"));
    3837             :                 }
    3838           0 :                 expect(token_type::uninitialized);
    3839             :             }
    3840           0 :             break;
    3841             :         }
    3842             : 
    3843             :         case token_type::parse_error:
    3844             :         {
    3845             :             // using "uninitialized" to avoid "expected" message
    3846           0 :             if (not expect(token_type::uninitialized))
    3847             :             {
    3848           0 :                 return;
    3849             :             }
    3850             :             break; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
    3851             :         }
    3852             : 
    3853             :         default:
    3854             :         {
    3855             :             // the last token was unexpected; we expected a value
    3856           0 :             if (not expect(token_type::literal_or_value))
    3857             :             {
    3858           0 :                 return;
    3859             :             }
    3860             :             break; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
    3861             :         }
    3862             :         }
    3863             : 
    3864         220 :         if (keep and callback and
    3865           0 :             not callback(depth, parse_event_t::value, result))
    3866             :         {
    3867           0 :             result.m_value.destroy(result.m_type);
    3868           0 :             result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
    3869             :         }
    3870             :     }
    3871             : 
    3872             :     /*!
    3873             :     @brief the actual acceptor
    3874             : 
    3875             :     @invariant 1. The last token is not yet processed. Therefore, the caller
    3876             :                   of this function must make sure a token has been read.
    3877             :                2. When this function returns, the last token is processed.
    3878             :                   That is, the last read character was already considered.
    3879             : 
    3880             :     This invariant makes sure that no token needs to be "unput".
    3881             :     */
    3882             :     bool accept_internal()
    3883             :     {
    3884             :         switch (last_token)
    3885             :         {
    3886             :         case token_type::begin_object:
    3887             :         {
    3888             :             // read next token
    3889             :             get_token();
    3890             : 
    3891             :             // closing } -> we are done
    3892             :             if (last_token == token_type::end_object)
    3893             :             {
    3894             :                 return true;
    3895             :             }
    3896             : 
    3897             :             // parse values
    3898             :             while (true)
    3899             :             {
    3900             :                 // parse key
    3901             :                 if (last_token != token_type::value_string)
    3902             :                 {
    3903             :                     return false;
    3904             :                 }
    3905             : 
    3906             :                 // parse separator (:)
    3907             :                 get_token();
    3908             :                 if (last_token != token_type::name_separator)
    3909             :                 {
    3910             :                     return false;
    3911             :                 }
    3912             : 
    3913             :                 // parse value
    3914             :                 get_token();
    3915             :                 if (not accept_internal())
    3916             :                 {
    3917             :                     return false;
    3918             :                 }
    3919             : 
    3920             :                 // comma -> next value
    3921             :                 get_token();
    3922             :                 if (last_token == token_type::value_separator)
    3923             :                 {
    3924             :                     get_token();
    3925             :                     continue;
    3926             :                 }
    3927             : 
    3928             :                 // closing }
    3929             :                 return (last_token == token_type::end_object);
    3930             :             }
    3931             :         }
    3932             : 
    3933             :         case token_type::begin_array:
    3934             :         {
    3935             :             // read next token
    3936             :             get_token();
    3937             : 
    3938             :             // closing ] -> we are done
    3939             :             if (last_token == token_type::end_array)
    3940             :             {
    3941             :                 return true;
    3942             :             }
    3943             : 
    3944             :             // parse values
    3945             :             while (true)
    3946             :             {
    3947             :                 // parse value
    3948             :                 if (not accept_internal())
    3949             :                 {
    3950             :                     return false;
    3951             :                 }
    3952             : 
    3953             :                 // comma -> next value
    3954             :                 get_token();
    3955             :                 if (last_token == token_type::value_separator)
    3956             :                 {
    3957             :                     get_token();
    3958             :                     continue;
    3959             :                 }
    3960             : 
    3961             :                 // closing ]
    3962             :                 return (last_token == token_type::end_array);
    3963             :             }
    3964             :         }
    3965             : 
    3966             :         case token_type::value_float:
    3967             :         {
    3968             :             // reject infinity or NAN
    3969             :             return std::isfinite(m_lexer.get_number_float());
    3970             :         }
    3971             : 
    3972             :         case token_type::literal_false:
    3973             :         case token_type::literal_null:
    3974             :         case token_type::literal_true:
    3975             :         case token_type::value_integer:
    3976             :         case token_type::value_string:
    3977             :         case token_type::value_unsigned:
    3978             :             return true;
    3979             : 
    3980             :         default: // the last token was unexpected
    3981             :             return false;
    3982             :         }
    3983             :     }
    3984             : 
    3985             :     /// get next token from lexer
    3986         792 :     token_type get_token() { return (last_token = m_lexer.scan()); }
    3987             :     /*!
    3988             :     @throw parse_error.101 if expected token did not occur
    3989             :     */
    3990         462 :     bool expect(token_type t)
    3991             :     {
    3992         462 :         if (JSON_UNLIKELY(t != last_token))
    3993             :         {
    3994           0 :             errored = true;
    3995           0 :             expected = t;
    3996           0 :             if (allow_exceptions)
    3997             :             {
    3998           0 :                 throw_exception();
    3999             :             }
    4000             :             else
    4001             :             {
    4002           0 :                 return false;
    4003             :             }
    4004             :         }
    4005             : 
    4006         462 :         return true;
    4007             :     }
    4008             : 
    4009           0 :     [[noreturn]] void throw_exception() const
    4010             :     {
    4011           0 :         std::string error_msg = "syntax error - ";
    4012           0 :         if (last_token == token_type::parse_error)
    4013             :         {
    4014           0 :             error_msg += std::string(m_lexer.get_error_message()) +
    4015             :                          "; last read: '" + m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'";
    4016             :         }
    4017             :         else
    4018             :         {
    4019           0 :             error_msg += "unexpected " +
    4020           0 :                          std::string(lexer_t::token_type_name(last_token));
    4021             :         }
    4022             : 
    4023           0 :         if (expected != token_type::uninitialized)
    4024             :         {
    4025           0 :             error_msg +=
    4026           0 :                 "; expected " + std::string(lexer_t::token_type_name(expected));
    4027             :         }
    4028             : 
    4029           0 :         JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(), error_msg));
    4030             :     }
    4031             : 
    4032             : private:
    4033             :     /// current level of recursion
    4034             :     int depth = 0;
    4035             :     /// callback function
    4036             :     const parser_callback_t callback = nullptr;
    4037             :     /// the type of the last read token
    4038             :     token_type last_token = token_type::uninitialized;
    4039             :     /// the lexer
    4040             :     lexer_t m_lexer;
    4041             :     /// whether a syntax error occurred
    4042             :     bool errored = false;
    4043             :     /// possible reason for the syntax error
    4044             :     token_type expected = token_type::uninitialized;
    4045             :     /// whether to throw exceptions in case of errors
    4046             :     const bool allow_exceptions = true;
    4047             : };
    4048             : }

    4050             : 
    4051             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/primitive_iterator.hpp>
    4052             : 
    4053             : #include <cstddef> // ptrdiff_t
    4054             : #include <limits>  // numeric_limits
    4055             : 
    4056             : namespace brion_nlohmann
    4057             : {
    4058             : namespace detail
    4059             : {
    4060             : /*
    4061             : @brief an iterator for primitive JSON types
    4062             : 
    4063             : This class models an iterator for primitive JSON types (boolean, number,
    4064             : string). It's only purpose is to allow the iterator/const_iterator classes
    4065             : to "iterate" over primitive values. Internally, the iterator is modeled by
    4066             : a `difference_type` variable. Value begin_value (`0`) models the begin,
    4067             : end_value (`1`) models past the end.
    4068             : */
    4069         550 : class primitive_iterator_t
    4070             : {
    4071             : private:
    4072             :     using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
    4073             :     static constexpr difference_type begin_value = 0;
    4074             :     static constexpr difference_type end_value = begin_value + 1;
    4075             : 
    4076             :     /// iterator as signed integer type
    4077         275 :     difference_type m_it = (std::numeric_limits<std::ptrdiff_t>::min)();
    4078             : 
    4079             : public:
    4080             :     constexpr difference_type get_value() const noexcept { return m_it; }
    4081             :     /// set iterator to a defined beginning
    4082           0 :     void set_begin() noexcept { m_it = begin_value; }
    4083             :     /// set iterator to a defined past the end
    4084           0 :     void set_end() noexcept { m_it = end_value; }
    4085             :     /// return whether the iterator can be dereferenced
    4086           0 :     constexpr bool is_begin() const noexcept { return m_it == begin_value; }
    4087             :     /// return whether the iterator is at end
    4088             :     constexpr bool is_end() const noexcept { return m_it == end_value; }
    4089           0 :     friend constexpr bool operator==(primitive_iterator_t lhs,
    4090             :                                      primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
    4091             :     {
    4092           0 :         return lhs.m_it == rhs.m_it;
    4093             :     }
    4094             : 
    4095             :     friend constexpr bool operator<(primitive_iterator_t lhs,
    4096             :                                     primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
    4097             :     {
    4098             :         return lhs.m_it < rhs.m_it;
    4099             :     }
    4100             : 
    4101             :     primitive_iterator_t operator+(difference_type n) noexcept
    4102             :     {
    4103             :         auto result = *this;
    4104             :         result += n;
    4105             :         return result;
    4106             :     }
    4107             : 
    4108             :     friend constexpr difference_type operator-(
    4109             :         primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
    4110             :     {
    4111             :         return lhs.m_it - rhs.m_it;
    4112             :     }
    4113             : 
    4114           0 :     primitive_iterator_t& operator++() noexcept
    4115             :     {
    4116           0 :         ++m_it;
    4117           0 :         return *this;
    4118             :     }
    4119             : 
    4120             :     primitive_iterator_t const operator++(int)noexcept
    4121             :     {
    4122             :         auto result = *this;
    4123             :         m_it++;
    4124             :         return result;
    4125             :     }
    4126             : 
    4127             :     primitive_iterator_t& operator--() noexcept
    4128             :     {
    4129             :         --m_it;
    4130             :         return *this;
    4131             :     }
    4132             : 
    4133             :     primitive_iterator_t const operator--(int)noexcept
    4134             :     {
    4135             :         auto result = *this;
    4136             :         m_it--;
    4137             :         return result;
    4138             :     }
    4139             : 
    4140             :     primitive_iterator_t& operator+=(difference_type n) noexcept
    4141             :     {
    4142             :         m_it += n;
    4143             :         return *this;
    4144             :     }
    4145             : 
    4146             :     primitive_iterator_t& operator-=(difference_type n) noexcept
    4147             :     {
    4148             :         m_it -= n;
    4149             :         return *this;
    4150             :     }
    4151             : };
    4152             : }
    4153             : }
    4154             : 
    4155             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/internal_iterator.hpp>
    4156             : 
    4157             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/primitive_iterator.hpp>
    4158             : 
    4159             : namespace brion_nlohmann
    4160             : {
    4161             : namespace detail
    4162             : {
    4163             : /*!
    4164             : @brief an iterator value
    4165             : 
    4166             : @note This structure could easily be a union, but MSVC currently does not allow
    4167             : unions members with complex constructors, see
    4168             : https://github.com/nlohmann/json/pull/105.
    4169             : */
    4170             : template <typename BasicJsonType>
    4171         275 : struct internal_iterator
    4172             : {
    4173             :     /// iterator for JSON objects
    4174             :     typename BasicJsonType::object_t::iterator object_iterator{};
    4175             :     /// iterator for JSON arrays
    4176             :     typename BasicJsonType::array_t::iterator array_iterator{};
    4177             :     /// generic iterator for all other types
    4178             :     primitive_iterator_t primitive_iterator{};
    4179             : };
    4180             : }
    4181             : }
    4182             : 
    4183             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/iter_impl.hpp>
    4184             : 
    4185             : #include <ciso646>     // not
    4186             : #include <iterator>    // iterator, random_access_iterator_tag, bidirectional_iterator_tag, advance, next
    4187             : #include <type_traits> // conditional, is_const, remove_const
    4188             : 
    4189             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
    4190             : 
    4191             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/internal_iterator.hpp>
    4192             : 
    4193             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/primitive_iterator.hpp>
    4194             : 
    4195             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
    4196             : 
    4197             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta.hpp>
    4198             : 
    4199             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
    4200             : 
    4201             : namespace brion_nlohmann
    4202             : {
    4203             : namespace detail
    4204             : {
    4205             : // forward declare, to be able to friend it later on
    4206             : template <typename IteratorType>
    4207             : class iteration_proxy;
    4208             : 
    4209             : /*!
    4210             : @brief a template for a bidirectional iterator for the @ref basic_json class
    4211             : 
    4212             : This class implements a both iterators (iterator and const_iterator) for the
    4213             : @ref basic_json class.
    4214             : 
    4215             : @note An iterator is called *initialized* when a pointer to a JSON value has
    4216             :       been set (e.g., by a constructor or a copy assignment). If the iterator is
    4217             :       default-constructed, it is *uninitialized* and most methods are undefined.
    4218             :       **The library uses assertions to detect calls on uninitialized
    4219             : iterators.**
    4220             : 
    4221             : @requirement The class satisfies the following concept requirements:
    4222             : -
    4223             : [BidirectionalIterator](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/concept/BidirectionalIterator):
    4224             :   The iterator that can be moved can be moved in both directions (i.e.
    4225             :   incremented and decremented).
    4226             : 
    4227             : @since version 1.0.0, simplified in version 2.0.9, change to bidirectional
    4228             :        iterators in version 3.0.0 (see
    4229             : https://github.com/nlohmann/json/issues/593)
    4230             : */
    4231             : template <typename BasicJsonType>
    4232             : class iter_impl
    4233             : {
    4234             :     /// allow basic_json to access private members
    4235             :     friend iter_impl<typename std::conditional<
    4236             :         std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value,
    4237             :         typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type,
    4238             :         const BasicJsonType>::type>;
    4239             :     friend BasicJsonType;
    4240             :     friend iteration_proxy<iter_impl>;
    4241             : 
    4242             :     using object_t = typename BasicJsonType::object_t;
    4243             :     using array_t = typename BasicJsonType::array_t;
    4244             :     // make sure BasicJsonType is basic_json or const basic_json
    4245             :     static_assert(
    4246             :         is_basic_json<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>::value,
    4247             :         "iter_impl only accepts (const) basic_json");
    4248             : 
    4249             : public:
    4250             :     /// The std::iterator class template (used as a base class to provide
    4251             :     /// typedefs) is deprecated in C++17.
    4252             :     /// The C++ Standard has never required user-defined iterators to derive
    4253             :     /// from std::iterator.
    4254             :     /// A user-defined iterator should provide publicly accessible typedefs
    4255             :     /// named
    4256             :     /// iterator_category, value_type, difference_type, pointer, and reference.
    4257             :     /// Note that value_type is required to be non-const, even for constant
    4258             :     /// iterators.
    4259             :     using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag;
    4260             : 
    4261             :     /// the type of the values when the iterator is dereferenced
    4262             :     using value_type = typename BasicJsonType::value_type;
    4263             :     /// a type to represent differences between iterators
    4264             :     using difference_type = typename BasicJsonType::difference_type;
    4265             :     /// defines a pointer to the type iterated over (value_type)
    4266             :     using pointer =
    4267             :         typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value,
    4268             :                                   typename BasicJsonType::const_pointer,
    4269             :                                   typename BasicJsonType::pointer>::type;
    4270             :     /// defines a reference to the type iterated over (value_type)
    4271             :     using reference =
    4272             :         typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value,
    4273             :                                   typename BasicJsonType::const_reference,
    4274             :                                   typename BasicJsonType::reference>::type;
    4275             : 
    4276             :     /// default constructor
    4277             :     iter_impl() = default;
    4278             : 
    4279             :     /*!
    4280             :     @brief constructor for a given JSON instance
    4281             :     @param[in] object  pointer to a JSON object for this iterator
    4282             :     @pre object != nullptr
    4283             :     @post The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    4284             :     */
    4285         275 :     explicit iter_impl(pointer object) noexcept : m_object(object)
    4286             :     {
    4287         275 :         assert(m_object != nullptr);
    4288             : 
    4289         275 :         switch (m_object->m_type)
    4290             :         {
    4291             :         case value_t::object:
    4292             :         {
    4293         231 :             m_it.object_iterator = typename object_t::iterator();
    4294         231 :             break;
    4295             :         }
    4296             : 
    4297             :         case value_t::array:
    4298             :         {
    4299          44 :             m_it.array_iterator = typename array_t::iterator();
    4300          44 :             break;
    4301             :         }
    4302             : 
    4303             :         default:
    4304             :         {
    4305           0 :             m_it.primitive_iterator = primitive_iterator_t();
    4306           0 :             break;
    4307             :         }
    4308             :         }
    4309         275 :     }
    4310             : 
    4311             :     /*!
    4312             :     @note The conventional copy constructor and copy assignment are implicitly
    4313             :           defined. Combined with the following converting constructor and
    4314             :           assignment, they support: (1) copy from iterator to iterator, (2)
    4315             :           copy from const iterator to const iterator, and (3) conversion from
    4316             :           iterator to const iterator. However conversion from const iterator
    4317             :           to iterator is not defined.
    4318             :     */
    4319             : 
    4320             :     /*!
    4321             :     @brief converting constructor
    4322             :     @param[in] other  non-const iterator to copy from
    4323             :     @note It is not checked whether @a other is initialized.
    4324             :     */
    4325             :     iter_impl(const iter_impl<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>&
    4326             :                   other) noexcept : m_object(other.m_object),
    4327             :                                     m_it(other.m_it)
    4328             :     {
    4329             :     }
    4330             : 
    4331             :     /*!
    4332             :     @brief converting assignment
    4333             :     @param[in,out] other  non-const iterator to copy from
    4334             :     @return const/non-const iterator
    4335             :     @note It is not checked whether @a other is initialized.
    4336             :     */
    4337             :     iter_impl& operator=(
    4338             :         const iter_impl<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>&
    4339             :             other) noexcept
    4340             :     {
    4341             :         m_object = other.m_object;
    4342             :         m_it = other.m_it;
    4343             :         return *this;
    4344             :     }
    4345             : 
    4346             : private:
    4347             :     /*!
    4348             :     @brief set the iterator to the first value
    4349             :     @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    4350             :     */
    4351          55 :     void set_begin() noexcept
    4352             :     {
    4353          55 :         assert(m_object != nullptr);
    4354             : 
    4355          55 :         switch (m_object->m_type)
    4356             :         {
    4357             :         case value_t::object:
    4358             :         {
    4359          33 :             m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->begin();
    4360          33 :             break;
    4361             :         }
    4362             : 
    4363             :         case value_t::array:
    4364             :         {
    4365          22 :             m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->begin();
    4366          22 :             break;
    4367             :         }
    4368             : 
    4369             :         case value_t::null:
    4370             :         {
    4371             :             // set to end so begin()==end() is true: null is empty
    4372           0 :             m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
    4373           0 :             break;
    4374             :         }
    4375             : 
    4376             :         default:
    4377             :         {
    4378           0 :             m_it.primitive_iterator.set_begin();
    4379           0 :             break;
    4380             :         }
    4381             :         }
    4382          55 :     }
    4383             : 
    4384             :     /*!
    4385             :     @brief set the iterator past the last value
    4386             :     @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    4387             :     */
    4388         220 :     void set_end() noexcept
    4389             :     {
    4390         220 :         assert(m_object != nullptr);
    4391             : 
    4392         220 :         switch (m_object->m_type)
    4393             :         {
    4394             :         case value_t::object:
    4395             :         {
    4396         198 :             m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->end();
    4397         198 :             break;
    4398             :         }
    4399             : 
    4400             :         case value_t::array:
    4401             :         {
    4402          22 :             m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->end();
    4403          22 :             break;
    4404             :         }
    4405             : 
    4406             :         default:
    4407             :         {
    4408           0 :             m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
    4409           0 :             break;
    4410             :         }
    4411             :         }
    4412         220 :     }
    4413             : 
    4414             : public:
    4415             :     /*!
    4416             :     @brief return a reference to the value pointed to by the iterator
    4417             :     @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    4418             :     */

    4420             :     {
    4421         440 :         assert(m_object != nullptr);
    4422             : 
    4423         440 :         switch (m_object->m_type)
    4424             :         {
    4425             :         case value_t::object:
    4426             :         {
    4427         407 :             assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
    4428         407 :             return m_it.object_iterator->second;
    4429             :         }
    4430             : 
    4431             :         case value_t::array:
    4432             :         {
    4433          33 :             assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());

    4435             :         }

    4438           0 :             JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));

    4441             :         {
    4442           0 :             if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
    4443             :             {

    4445             :             }
    4446             : 
    4447           0 :             JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));

    4809             : private:

    4813             :     internal_iterator<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type> m_it;
    4814             : };

    4817             : 
    4818             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/iteration_proxy.hpp>
    4819             : 
    4820             : #include <cstddef> // size_t
    4821             : #include <string>  // string, to_string
    4822             : 
    4823             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
    4824             : 
    4825             : namespace brion_nlohmann
    4826             : {
    4827             : namespace detail
    4828             : {
    4829             : /// proxy class for the items() function
    4830             : template <typename IteratorType>
    4831             : class iteration_proxy
    4832             : {
    4833             : private:
    4834             :     /// helper class for iteration
    4835             :     class iteration_proxy_internal
    4836             :     {
    4837             :     private:
    4838             :         /// the iterator
    4839             :         IteratorType anchor;
    4840             :         /// an index for arrays (used to create key names)
    4841             :         std::size_t array_index = 0;
    4842             : 
    4843             :     public:
    4844             :         explicit iteration_proxy_internal(IteratorType it) noexcept : anchor(it)
    4845             :         {
    4846             :         }
    4847             : 
    4848             :         /// dereference operator (needed for range-based for)
    4849             :         iteration_proxy_internal& operator*() { return *this; }
    4850             :         /// increment operator (needed for range-based for)
    4851             :         iteration_proxy_internal& operator++()
    4852             :         {
    4853             :             ++anchor;
    4854             :             ++array_index;
    4855             : 
    4856             :             return *this;
    4857             :         }
    4858             : 
    4859             :         /// inequality operator (needed for range-based for)
    4860             :         bool operator!=(const iteration_proxy_internal& o) const noexcept
    4861             :         {
    4862             :             return anchor != o.anchor;
    4863             :         }
    4864             : 
    4865             :         /// return key of the iterator
    4866             :         std::string key() const
    4867             :         {
    4868             :             assert(anchor.m_object != nullptr);
    4869             : 
    4870             :             switch (anchor.m_object->type())
    4871             :             {
    4872             :             // use integer array index as key
    4873             :             case value_t::array:
    4874             :                 return std::to_string(array_index);
    4875             : 
    4876             :             // use key from the object
    4877             :             case value_t::object:
    4878             :                 return anchor.key();
    4879             : 
    4880             :             // use an empty key for all primitive types
    4881             :             default:
    4882             :                 return "";
    4883             :             }
    4884             :         }
    4885             : 
    4886             :         /// return value of the iterator
    4887             :         typename IteratorType::reference value() const
    4888             :         {
    4889             :             return anchor.value();
    4890             :         }
    4891             :     };
    4892             : 
    4893             :     /// the container to iterate
    4894             :     typename IteratorType::reference container;
    4895             : 
    4896             : public:
    4897             :     /// construct iteration proxy from a container
    4898             :     explicit iteration_proxy(typename IteratorType::reference cont) noexcept
    4899             :         : container(cont)
    4900             :     {
    4901             :     }
    4902             : 
    4903             :     /// return iterator begin (needed for range-based for)
    4904             :     iteration_proxy_internal begin() noexcept
    4905             :     {
    4906             :         return iteration_proxy_internal(container.begin());
    4907             :     }
    4908             : 
    4909             :     /// return iterator end (needed for range-based for)
    4910             :     iteration_proxy_internal end() noexcept
    4911             :     {
    4912             :         return iteration_proxy_internal(container.end());
    4913             :     }
    4914             : };
    4915             : }
    4916             : }
    4917             : 
    4918             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/json_reverse_iterator.hpp>
    4919             : 
    4920             : #include <cstddef>  // ptrdiff_t
    4921             : #include <iterator> // reverse_iterator
    4922             : #include <utility>  // declval
    4923             : 
    4924             : namespace brion_nlohmann
    4925             : {
    4926             : namespace detail
    4927             : {
    4928             : //////////////////////
    4929             : // reverse_iterator //
    4930             : //////////////////////
    4931             : 
    4932             : /*!
    4933             : @brief a template for a reverse iterator class
    4934             : 
    4935             : @tparam Base the base iterator type to reverse. Valid types are @ref
    4936             : iterator (to create @ref reverse_iterator) and @ref const_iterator (to
    4937             : create @ref const_reverse_iterator).
    4938             : 
    4939             : @requirement The class satisfies the following concept requirements:
    4940             : -
    4941             : [BidirectionalIterator](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/concept/BidirectionalIterator):
    4942             :   The iterator that can be moved can be moved in both directions (i.e.
    4943             :   incremented and decremented).
    4944             : - [OutputIterator](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/concept/OutputIterator):
    4945             :   It is possible to write to the pointed-to element (only if @a Base is
    4946             :   @ref iterator).
    4947             : 
    4948             : @since version 1.0.0
    4949             : */
    4950             : template <typename Base>
    4951             : class json_reverse_iterator : public std::reverse_iterator<Base>
    4952             : {
    4953             : public:
    4954             :     using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
    4955             :     /// shortcut to the reverse iterator adapter
    4956             :     using base_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<Base>;
    4957             :     /// the reference type for the pointed-to element
    4958             :     using reference = typename Base::reference;
    4959             : 
    4960             :     /// create reverse iterator from iterator
    4961             :     json_reverse_iterator(
    4962             :         const typename base_iterator::iterator_type& it) noexcept
    4963             :         : base_iterator(it)
    4964             :     {
    4965             :     }
    4966             : 
    4967             :     /// create reverse iterator from base class
    4968             :     json_reverse_iterator(const base_iterator& it) noexcept : base_iterator(it)
    4969             :     {
    4970             :     }
    4971             : 
    4972             :     /// post-increment (it++)
    4973             :     json_reverse_iterator const operator++(int)
    4974             :     {
    4975             :         return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator++(1));
    4976             :     }
    4977             : 
    4978             :     /// pre-increment (++it)
    4979             :     json_reverse_iterator& operator++()
    4980             :     {
    4981             :         return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator++());
    4982             :     }
    4983             : 
    4984             :     /// post-decrement (it--)
    4985             :     json_reverse_iterator const operator--(int)
    4986             :     {
    4987             :         return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator--(1));
    4988             :     }
    4989             : 
    4990             :     /// pre-decrement (--it)
    4991             :     json_reverse_iterator& operator--()
    4992             :     {
    4993             :         return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator--());
    4994             :     }
    4995             : 
    4996             :     /// add to iterator
    4997             :     json_reverse_iterator& operator+=(difference_type i)
    4998             :     {
    4999             :         return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(
    5000             :             base_iterator::operator+=(i));
    5001             :     }
    5002             : 
    5003             :     /// add to iterator
    5004             :     json_reverse_iterator operator+(difference_type i) const
    5005             :     {
    5006             :         return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator+(i));
    5007             :     }
    5008             : 
    5009             :     /// subtract from iterator
    5010             :     json_reverse_iterator operator-(difference_type i) const
    5011             :     {
    5012             :         return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator-(i));
    5013             :     }
    5014             : 
    5015             :     /// return difference
    5016             :     difference_type operator-(const json_reverse_iterator& other) const
    5017             :     {
    5018             :         return base_iterator(*this) - base_iterator(other);
    5019             :     }
    5020             : 
    5021             :     /// access to successor
    5022             :     reference operator[](difference_type n) const
    5023             :     {
    5024             :         return *(this->operator+(n));
    5025             :     }
    5026             : 
    5027             :     /// return the key of an object iterator
    5028             :     auto key() const -> decltype(std::declval<Base>().key())
    5029             :     {
    5030             :         auto it = --this->base();
    5031             :         return it.key();
    5032             :     }
    5033             : 
    5034             :     /// return the value of an iterator
    5035             :     reference value() const
    5036             :     {
    5037             :         auto it = --this->base();
    5038             :         return it.operator*();
    5039             :     }
    5040             : };
    5041             : }
    5042             : }
    5043             : 
    5044             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/output/output_adapters.hpp>
    5045             : 
    5046             : #include <algorithm> // copy
    5047             : #include <cstddef>   // size_t
    5048             : #include <ios>       // streamsize
    5049             : #include <iterator>  // back_inserter
    5050             : #include <memory>    // shared_ptr, make_shared
    5051             : #include <ostream>   // basic_ostream
    5052             : #include <string>    // basic_string
    5053             : #include <vector>    // vector
    5054             : 
    5055             : namespace brion_nlohmann
    5056             : {
    5057             : namespace detail
    5058             : {
    5059             : /// abstract output adapter interface
    5060             : template <typename CharType>
    5061             : struct output_adapter_protocol
    5062             : {
    5063             :     virtual void write_character(CharType c) = 0;
    5064             :     virtual void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) = 0;
    5065             :     virtual ~output_adapter_protocol() = default;
    5066             : };
    5067             : 
    5068             : /// a type to simplify interfaces
    5069             : template <typename CharType>
    5070             : using output_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<output_adapter_protocol<CharType>>;
    5071             : 
    5072             : /// output adapter for byte vectors
    5073             : template <typename CharType>
    5074             : class output_vector_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
    5075             : {
    5076             : public:
    5077             :     explicit output_vector_adapter(std::vector<CharType>& vec)
    5078             :         : v(vec)
    5079             :     {
    5080             :     }
    5081             : 
    5082             :     void write_character(CharType c) override { v.push_back(c); }
    5083             :     void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
    5084             :     {
    5085             :         std::copy(s, s + length, std::back_inserter(v));
    5086             :     }
    5087             : 
    5088             : private:
    5089             :     std::vector<CharType>& v;
    5090             : };
    5091             : 
    5092             : /// output adapter for output streams
    5093             : template <typename CharType>
    5094             : class output_stream_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
    5095             : {
    5096             : public:
    5097             :     explicit output_stream_adapter(std::basic_ostream<CharType>& s)
    5098             :         : stream(s)
    5099             :     {
    5100             :     }
    5101             : 
    5102             :     void write_character(CharType c) override { stream.put(c); }
    5103             :     void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
    5104             :     {
    5105             :         stream.write(s, static_cast<std::streamsize>(length));
    5106             :     }
    5107             : 
    5108             : private:
    5109             :     std::basic_ostream<CharType>& stream;
    5110             : };
    5111             : 
    5112             : /// output adapter for basic_string
    5113             : template <typename CharType, typename StringType = std::basic_string<CharType>>
    5114             : class output_string_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
    5115             : {
    5116             : public:
    5117             :     explicit output_string_adapter(StringType& s)
    5118             :         : str(s)
    5119             :     {
    5120             :     }
    5121             : 
    5122             :     void write_character(CharType c) override { str.push_back(c); }
    5123             :     void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
    5124             :     {
    5125             :         str.append(s, length);
    5126             :     }
    5127             : 
    5128             : private:
    5129             :     StringType& str;
    5130             : };
    5131             : 
    5132             : template <typename CharType, typename StringType = std::basic_string<CharType>>
    5133             : class output_adapter
    5134             : {
    5135             : public:
    5136             :     output_adapter(std::vector<CharType>& vec)
    5137             :         : oa(std::make_shared<output_vector_adapter<CharType>>(vec))
    5138             :     {
    5139             :     }
    5140             : 
    5141             :     output_adapter(std::basic_ostream<CharType>& s)
    5142             :         : oa(std::make_shared<output_stream_adapter<CharType>>(s))
    5143             :     {
    5144             :     }
    5145             : 
    5146             :     output_adapter(StringType& s)
    5147             :         : oa(std::make_shared<output_string_adapter<CharType, StringType>>(s))
    5148             :     {
    5149             :     }
    5150             : 
    5151             :     operator output_adapter_t<CharType>() { return oa; }
    5152             : private:
    5153             :     output_adapter_t<CharType> oa = nullptr;
    5154             : };
    5155             : }
    5156             : }
    5157             : 
    5158             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/binary_reader.hpp>
    5159             : 
    5160             : #include <algorithm> // generate_n
    5161             : #include <array>     // array
    5162             : #include <cassert>   // assert
    5163             : #include <cmath>     // ldexp
    5164             : #include <cstddef>   // size_t
    5165             : #include <cstdint>   // uint8_t, uint16_t, uint32_t, uint64_t
    5166             : #include <cstring>   // memcpy
    5167             : #include <iomanip>   // setw, setfill
    5168             : #include <ios>       // hex
    5169             : #include <iterator>  // back_inserter
    5170             : #include <limits>    // numeric_limits
    5171             : #include <sstream>   // stringstream
    5172             : #include <string>    // char_traits, string
    5173             : #include <utility>   // make_pair, move
    5174             : 
    5175             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/input_adapters.hpp>
    5176             : 
    5177             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
    5178             : 
    5179             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
    5180             : 
    5181             : // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
    5182             : 
    5183             : namespace brion_nlohmann
    5184             : {
    5185             : namespace detail
    5186             : {
    5187             : ///////////////////
    5188             : // binary reader //
    5189             : ///////////////////
    5190             : 
    5191             : /*!
    5192             : @brief deserialization of CBOR and MessagePack values
    5193             : */
    5194             : template <typename BasicJsonType>
    5195             : class binary_reader
    5196             : {
    5197             :     using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
    5198             :     using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
    5199             :     using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
    5200             : 
    5201             : public:
    5202             :     /*!
    5203             :     @brief create a binary reader
    5204             : 
    5205             :     @param[in] adapter  input adapter to read from
    5206             :     */
    5207             :     explicit binary_reader(input_adapter_t adapter)
    5208             :         : ia(std::move(adapter))
    5209             :     {
    5210             :         assert(ia);
    5211             :     }
    5212             : 
    5213             :     /*!
    5214             :     @brief create a JSON value from CBOR input
    5215             : 
    5216             :     @param[in] strict  whether to expect the input to be consumed completed
    5217             :     @return JSON value created from CBOR input
    5218             : 
    5219             :     @throw parse_error.110 if input ended unexpectedly or the end of file was
    5220             :                            not reached when @a strict was set to true
    5221             :     @throw parse_error.112 if unsupported byte was read
    5222             :     */
    5223             :     BasicJsonType parse_cbor(const bool strict)
    5224             :     {
    5225             :         const auto res = parse_cbor_internal();
    5226             :         if (strict)
    5227             :         {
    5228             :             get();
    5229             :             expect_eof();
    5230             :         }
    5231             :         return res;
    5232             :     }
    5233             : 
    5234             :     /*!
    5235             :     @brief create a JSON value from MessagePack input
    5236             : 
    5237             :     @param[in] strict  whether to expect the input to be consumed completed
    5238             :     @return JSON value created from MessagePack input
    5239             : 
    5240             :     @throw parse_error.110 if input ended unexpectedly or the end of file was
    5241             :                            not reached when @a strict was set to true
    5242             :     @throw parse_error.112 if unsupported byte was read
    5243             :     */
    5244             :     BasicJsonType parse_msgpack(const bool strict)
    5245             :     {
    5246             :         const auto res = parse_msgpack_internal();
    5247             :         if (strict)
    5248             :         {
    5249             :             get();
    5250             :             expect_eof();
    5251             :         }
    5252             :         return res;
    5253             :     }
    5254             : 
    5255             :     /*!
    5256             :     @brief create a JSON value from UBJSON input
    5257             : 
    5258             :     @param[in] strict  whether to expect the input to be consumed completed
    5259             :     @return JSON value created from UBJSON input
    5260             : 
    5261             :     @throw parse_error.110 if input ended unexpectedly or the end of file was
    5262             :                            not reached when @a strict was set to true
    5263             :     @throw parse_error.112 if unsupported byte was read
    5264             :     */
    5265             :     BasicJsonType parse_ubjson(const bool strict)
    5266             :     {
    5267             :         const auto res = parse_ubjson_internal();
    5268             :         if (strict)
    5269             :         {
    5270             :             get_ignore_noop();
    5271             :             expect_eof();
    5272             :         }
    5273             :         return res;
    5274             :     }
    5275             : 
    5276             :     /*!
    5277             :     @brief determine system byte order
    5278             : 
    5279             :     @return true if and only if system's byte order is little endian
    5280             : 
    5281             :     @note from http://stackoverflow.com/a/1001328/266378
    5282             :     */
    5283             :     static constexpr bool little_endianess(int num = 1) noexcept
    5284             :     {
    5285             :         return (*reinterpret_cast<char*>(&num) == 1);
    5286             :     }
    5287             : 
    5288             : private:
    5289             :     /*!
    5290             :     @param[in] get_char  whether a new character should be retrieved from the
    5291             :                          input (true, default) or whether the last read
    5292             :                          character should be considered instead
    5293             :     */
    5294             :     BasicJsonType parse_cbor_internal(const bool get_char = true)
    5295             :     {
    5296             :         switch (get_char ? get() : current)
    5297             :         {
    5298             :         // EOF
    5299             :         case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
    5300             :             JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read,
    5301             :                                            "unexpected end of input"));
    5302             : 
    5303             :         // Integer 0x00..0x17 (0..23)
    5304             :         case 0x00:
    5305             :         case 0x01:
    5306             :         case 0x02:
    5307             :         case 0x03:
    5308             :         case 0x04:
    5309             :         case 0x05:
    5310             :         case 0x06:
    5311             :         case 0x07:
    5312             :         case 0x08:
    5313             :         case 0x09:
    5314             :         case 0x0A:
    5315             :         case 0x0B:
    5316             :         case 0x0C:
    5317             :         case 0x0D:
    5318             :         case 0x0E:
    5319             :         case 0x0F:
    5320             :         case 0x10:
    5321             :         case 0x11:
    5322             :         case 0x12:
    5323             :         case 0x13:
    5324             :         case 0x14:
    5325             :         case 0x15:
    5326             :         case 0x16:
    5327             :         case 0x17:
    5328             :             return static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current);
    5329             : 
    5330             :         case 0x18: // Unsigned integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
    5331             :             return get_number<uint8_t>();
    5332             : 
    5333             :         case 0x19: // Unsigned integer (two-byte uint16_t follows)
    5334             :             return get_number<uint16_t>();
    5335             : 
    5336             :         case 0x1A: // Unsigned integer (four-byte uint32_t follows)
    5337             :             return get_number<uint32_t>();
    5338             : 
    5339             :         case 0x1B: // Unsigned integer (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
    5340             :             return get_number<uint64_t>();
    5341             : 
    5342             :         // Negative integer -1-0x00..-1-0x17 (-1..-24)
    5343             :         case 0x20:
    5344             :         case 0x21:
    5345             :         case 0x22:
    5346             :         case 0x23:
    5347             :         case 0x24:
    5348             :         case 0x25:
    5349             :         case 0x26:
    5350             :         case 0x27:
    5351             :         case 0x28:
    5352             :         case 0x29:
    5353             :         case 0x2A:
    5354             :         case 0x2B:
    5355             :         case 0x2C:
    5356             :         case 0x2D:
    5357             :         case 0x2E:
    5358             :         case 0x2F:
    5359             :         case 0x30:
    5360             :         case 0x31:
    5361             :         case 0x32:
    5362             :         case 0x33:
    5363             :         case 0x34:
    5364             :         case 0x35:
    5365             :         case 0x36:
    5366             :         case 0x37:
    5367             :             return static_cast<int8_t>(0x20 - 1 - current);
    5368             : 
    5369             :         case 0x38: // Negative integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
    5370             :         {
    5371             :             return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint8_t>();
    5372             :         }
    5373             : 
    5374             :         case 0x39: // Negative integer -1-n (two-byte uint16_t follows)
    5375             :         {
    5376             :             return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint16_t>();
    5377             :         }
    5378             : 
    5379             :         case 0x3A: // Negative integer -1-n (four-byte uint32_t follows)
    5380             :         {
    5381             :             return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint32_t>();
    5382             :         }
    5383             : 
    5384             :         case 0x3B: // Negative integer -1-n (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
    5385             :         {
    5386             :             return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) -
    5387             :                    static_cast<number_integer_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
    5388             :         }
    5389             : 
    5390             :         // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
    5391             :         case 0x60:
    5392             :         case 0x61:
    5393             :         case 0x62:
    5394             :         case 0x63:
    5395             :         case 0x64:
    5396             :         case 0x65:
    5397             :         case 0x66:
    5398             :         case 0x67:
    5399             :         case 0x68:
    5400             :         case 0x69:
    5401             :         case 0x6A:
    5402             :         case 0x6B:
    5403             :         case 0x6C:
    5404             :         case 0x6D:
    5405             :         case 0x6E:
    5406             :         case 0x6F:
    5407             :         case 0x70:
    5408             :         case 0x71:
    5409             :         case 0x72:
    5410             :         case 0x73:
    5411             :         case 0x74:
    5412             :         case 0x75:
    5413             :         case 0x76:
    5414             :         case 0x77:
    5415             :         case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
    5416             :         case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
    5417             :         case 0x7A: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
    5418             :         case 0x7B: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
    5419             :         case 0x7F: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
    5420             :         {
    5421             :             return get_cbor_string();
    5422             :         }
    5423             : 
    5424             :         // array (0x00..0x17 data items follow)
    5425             :         case 0x80:
    5426             :         case 0x81:
    5427             :         case 0x82:
    5428             :         case 0x83:
    5429             :         case 0x84:
    5430             :         case 0x85:
    5431             :         case 0x86:
    5432             :         case 0x87:
    5433             :         case 0x88:
    5434             :         case 0x89:
    5435             :         case 0x8A:
    5436             :         case 0x8B:
    5437             :         case 0x8C:
    5438             :         case 0x8D:
    5439             :         case 0x8E:
    5440             :         case 0x8F:
    5441             :         case 0x90:
    5442             :         case 0x91:
    5443             :         case 0x92:
    5444             :         case 0x93:
    5445             :         case 0x94:
    5446             :         case 0x95:
    5447             :         case 0x96:
    5448             :         case 0x97:
    5449             :         {
    5450             :             return get_cbor_array(current & 0x1F);
    5451             :         }
    5452             : 
    5453             :         case 0x98: // array (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
    5454             :         {
    5455             :             return get_cbor_array(get_number<uint8_t>());
    5456             :         }
    5457             : 
    5458             :         case 0x99: // array (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
    5459             :         {
    5460             :             return get_cbor_array(get_number<uint16_t>());
    5461             :         }
    5462             : 
    5463             :         case 0x9A: // array (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
    5464             :         {
    5465             :             return get_cbor_array(get_number<uint32_t>());
    5466             :         }
    5467             : 
    5468             :         case 0x9B: // array (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
    5469             :         {
    5470             :             return get_cbor_array(get_number<uint64_t>());
    5471             :         }
    5472             : 
    5473             :         case 0x9F: // array (indefinite length)
    5474             :         {
    5475             :             BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
    5476             :             while (get() != 0xFF)
    5477             :             {
    5478             :                 result.push_back(parse_cbor_internal(false));
    5479             :             }
    5480             :             return result;
    5481             :         }
    5482             : 
    5483             :         // map (0x00..0x17 pairs of data items follow)
    5484             :         case 0xA0:
    5485             :         case 0xA1:
    5486             :         case 0xA2:
    5487             :         case 0xA3:
    5488             :         case 0xA4:
    5489             :         case 0xA5:
    5490             :         case 0xA6:
    5491             :         case 0xA7:
    5492             :         case 0xA8:
    5493             :         case 0xA9:
    5494             :         case 0xAA:
    5495             :         case 0xAB:
    5496             :         case 0xAC:
    5497             :         case 0xAD:
    5498             :         case 0xAE:
    5499             :         case 0xAF:
    5500             :         case 0xB0:
    5501             :         case 0xB1:
    5502             :         case 0xB2:
    5503             :         case 0xB3:
    5504             :         case 0xB4:
    5505             :         case 0xB5:
    5506             :         case 0xB6:
    5507             :         case 0xB7:
    5508             :         {
    5509             :             return get_cbor_object(current & 0x1F);
    5510             :         }
    5511             : 
    5512             :         case 0xB8: // map (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
    5513             :         {
    5514             :             return get_cbor_object(get_number<uint8_t>());
    5515             :         }
    5516             : 
    5517             :         case 0xB9: // map (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
    5518             :         {
    5519             :             return get_cbor_object(get_number<uint16_t>());
    5520             :         }
    5521             : 
    5522             :         case 0xBA: // map (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
    5523             :         {
    5524             :             return get_cbor_object(get_number<uint32_t>());
    5525             :         }
    5526             : 
    5527             :         case 0xBB: // map (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
    5528             :         {
    5529             :             return get_cbor_object(get_number<uint64_t>());
    5530             :         }
    5531             : 
    5532             :         case 0xBF: // map (indefinite length)
    5533             :         {
    5534             :             BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
    5535             :             while (get() != 0xFF)
    5536             :             {
    5537             :                 auto key = get_cbor_string();
    5538             :                 result[key] = parse_cbor_internal();
    5539             :             }
    5540             :             return result;
    5541             :         }
    5542             : 
    5543             :         case 0xF4: // false
    5544             :         {
    5545             :             return false;
    5546             :         }
    5547             : 
    5548             :         case 0xF5: // true
    5549             :         {
    5550             :             return true;
    5551             :         }
    5552             : 
    5553             :         case 0xF6: // null
    5554             :         {
    5555             :             return value_t::null;
    5556             :         }
    5557             : 
    5558             :         case 0xF9: // Half-Precision Float (two-byte IEEE 754)
    5559             :         {
    5560             :             const int byte1 = get();
    5561             :             unexpect_eof();
    5562             :             const int byte2 = get();
    5563             :             unexpect_eof();
    5564             : 
    5565             :             // code from RFC 7049, Appendix D, Figure 3:
    5566             :             // As half-precision floating-point numbers were only added
    5567             :             // to IEEE 754 in 2008, today's programming platforms often
    5568             :             // still only have limited support for them. It is very
    5569             :             // easy to include at least decoding support for them even
    5570             :             // without such support. An example of a small decoder for
    5571             :             // half-precision floating-point numbers in the C language
    5572             :             // is shown in Fig. 3.
    5573             :             const int half = (byte1 << 8) + byte2;
    5574             :             const int exp = (half >> 10) & 0x1F;
    5575             :             const int mant = half & 0x3FF;
    5576             :             double val;
    5577             :             if (exp == 0)
    5578             :             {
    5579             :                 val = std::ldexp(mant, -24);
    5580             :             }
    5581             :             else if (exp != 31)
    5582             :             {
    5583             :                 val = std::ldexp(mant + 1024, exp - 25);
    5584             :             }
    5585             :             else
    5586             :             {
    5587             :                 val = (mant == 0) ? std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity()
    5588             :                                   : std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
    5589             :             }
    5590             :             return (half & 0x8000) != 0 ? -val : val;
    5591             :         }
    5592             : 
    5593             :         case 0xFA: // Single-Precision Float (four-byte IEEE 754)
    5594             :         {
    5595             :             return get_number<float>();
    5596             :         }
    5597             : 
    5598             :         case 0xFB: // Double-Precision Float (eight-byte IEEE 754)
    5599             :         {
    5600             :             return get_number<double>();
    5601             :         }
    5602             : 
    5603             :         default: // anything else (0xFF is handled inside the other types)
    5604             :         {
    5605             :             std::stringstream ss;
    5606             :             ss << std::setw(2) << std::uppercase << std::setfill('0')
    5607             :                << std::hex << current;
    5608             :             JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(112, chars_read,
    5609             :                                            "error reading CBOR; last byte: 0x" +
    5610             :                                                ss.str()));
    5611             :         }
    5612             :         }
    5613             :     }
    5614             : 
    5615             :     BasicJsonType parse_msgpack_internal()
    5616             :     {
    5617             :         switch (get())
    5618             :         {
    5619             :         // EOF
    5620             :         case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
    5621             :             JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read,
    5622             :                                            "unexpected end of input"));
    5623             : 
    5624             :         // positive fixint
    5625             :         case 0x00:
    5626             :         case 0x01:
    5627             :         case 0x02:
    5628             :         case 0x03:
    5629             :         case 0x04:
    5630             :         case 0x05:
    5631             :         case 0x06:

    5641             :         case 0x10:

    5802             :         case 0xA4:

    5810             :         case 0xAC:

    5812             :         case 0xAE:
    5813             :         case 0xAF:
    5814             :         case 0xB0:
    5815             :         case 0xB1:
    5816             :         case 0xB2:
    5817             :         case 0xB3:
    5818             :         case 0xB4:
    5819             :         case 0xB5:
    5820             :         case 0xB6:
    5821             :         case 0xB7:
    5822             :         case 0xB8:
    5823             :         case 0xB9:
    5824             :         case 0xBA:
    5825             :         case 0xBB:
    5826             :         case 0xBC:
    5827             :         case 0xBD:
    5828             :         case 0xBE:
    5829             :         case 0xBF:
    5830             :             return get_msgpack_string();
    5831             : 
    5832             :         case 0xC0: // nil
    5833             :             return value_t::null;
    5834             : 
    5835             :         case 0xC2: // false
    5836             :             return false;
    5837             : 
    5838             :         case 0xC3: // true
    5839             :             return true;
    5840             : 
    5841             :         case 0xCA: // float 32
    5842             :             return get_number<float>();
    5843             : 
    5844             :         case 0xCB: // float 64
    5845             :             return get_number<double>();
    5846             : 
    5847             :         case 0xCC: // uint 8
    5848             :             return get_number<uint8_t>();
    5849             : 
    5850             :         case 0xCD: // uint 16
    5851             :             return get_number<uint16_t>();
    5852             : 
    5853             :         case 0xCE: // uint 32
    5854             :             return get_number<uint32_t>();
    5855             : 
    5856             :         case 0xCF: // uint 64
    5857             :             return get_number<uint64_t>();
    5858             : 
    5859             :         case 0xD0: // int 8
    5860             :             return get_number<int8_t>();
    5861             : 
    5862             :         case 0xD1: // int 16
    5863             :             return get_number<int16_t>();
    5864             : 
    5865             :         case 0xD2: // int 32
    5866             :             return get_number<int32_t>();
    5867             : 
    5868             :         case 0xD3: // int 64
    5869             :             return get_number<int64_t>();
    5870             : 
    5871             :         case 0xD9: // str 8
    5872             :         case 0xDA: // str 16
    5873             :         case 0xDB: // str 32
    5874             :             return get_msgpack_string();
    5875             : 
    5876             :         case 0xDC: // array 16
    5877             :         {
    5878             :             return get_msgpack_array(get_number<uint16_t>());
    5879             :         }
    5880             : 
    5881             :         case 0xDD: // array 32
    5882             :         {
    5883             :             return get_msgpack_array(get_number<uint32_t>());
    5884             :         }
    5885             : 
    5886             :         case 0xDE: // map 16
    5887             :         {
    5888             :             return get_msgpack_object(get_number<uint16_t>());
    5889             :         }
    5890             : 
    5891             :         case 0xDF: // map 32
    5892             :         {
    5893             :             return get_msgpack_object(get_number<uint32_t>());
    5894             :         }
    5895             : 
    5896             :         // positive fixint
    5897             :         case 0xE0:
    5898             :         case 0xE1:
    5899             :         case 0xE2:
    5900             :         case 0xE3:
    5901             :         case 0xE4:
    5902             :         case 0xE5:
    5903             :         case 0xE6:
    5904             :         case 0xE7:
    5905             :         case 0xE8:
    5906             :         case 0xE9:
